name: Acropolis view-150 metres from Metro Monastiraki!
description: My house  is located in Monastiraki area, right in the heart of Athens, with immediate access in metro station, taxi station, in tons of coffee shops, bars, restaurants and all the main archaeological sites. Great advantage of my house is security. It is in a central street with lights and moving people 24 hours. The room will be sleeping is the quietest room in the house. I will send you list with very special places  to see in my city. See you here :) Makis
neighborhood_overview:
My neighborhood is the most charming area in Athens and you will never get bored. Everything is close by. All archeological sites, attractions and shops. The area is safe and you can find open shops with basic goods 24 hours. If I was visiting Athens for a few days i would definitely stay here.

Transfer
150 meters away from "Monastiraki" metro station
and 350m from "Thisio" metro station

Sites
"Ancient Agora of Athens": 350m
"Ancient Roman Agora": 500m
"Akropolis": 1000m

name: Athens panorama flat ( private room)
description:
Α colorful, cozy flat, close to museums, galleries, a big park and is located close to Athens center. Superb panoramic view of Acropolis and the sea, a big terrace, a shared living room, an independent guest room with wifi. Close to metro Ambelokipi.-
- Registration number- 00000128461.
neighborhood_overview: Its close to a big park and to galleries, museums. It has restaurants, cafeterias and supermarket within 5 minutes walking.
host_about:
My first priority/love is Art. I like theater performances, movies, jazz music, contructions and handmade artistry like mascs, vitraus, candles, light sets... On top of that I enjoy coocking a lot... I do pilates and yoga... and I walk quite a lot. I LOVE the sea and everything that goes with it. My favorite sport is rafting... I couldn't live with the sea and brightness of Greece... or without books, magazines and of course my beloved friends...
I'm very friendly and I'd like to share my good coocking and outstanding view with all my friends...
I've lived 3 years in London for my artistic studies, I've traveled to New York, Austria, France and Dubai.
My next trips will be Peru, Nepal and Green Cape.
I've worked at the theatrical, cinema and tv industries... as well as a fashion designer.
I like to meet new people and discover things...
I look everyday to taste something new...
Everyday has new experiences to offer for everyone, that will evolve us and keep our minds alive and our solves full of passion!
Ι also live at the flat (it is one room that i rent ) Registration number-  00000128461

name: Lovely BLUE private double room in Athens tourist
description: Welcome to our beautiful, clean, and private Airbnb double room in Athens! It's perfect for independent travelers who want comfort and convenience near the tourist center, with easy access to the airport and sea port. This SAFE residential area is just a 10-15 minute walk from the Acropolis and has a lovely balcony, fully equipped kitchen, shared bathroom, AC, WiFi, filter water, washing machine, PC, TV, safe box, and nearby restaurants and shops. Please READ HOUSE RULES and feel free to book!
neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to Koukaki, one of the most lively and vibrant neighborhoods in Athens! Our apartment is situated in the heart of this bustling area, just a stone's throw away from the iconic Acropolis and the world-renowned museums that surround it.

In addition to its close proximity to the main tourist areas and attractions, Koukaki is also well connected to both the airport and Piraeus port, making it a convenient location for travelers. You'll have easy access to public transportation options that will take you directly to these destinations.

Koukaki is a neighborhood filled with energy and character, boasting a wide variety of restaurants, cafes, bars, and shops that cater to every taste and preference. You'll find a diverse array of cuisines and dining options, from traditional Greek tavernas to modern international restaurants and everything in between.

Our apartment is located in the heart of this lively neighborhood, offering easy access to all the mai
host_about:
SINCE 2012 we have offered ACCOMMODATION with best price and quality relation.

As being travelers ourselves we know what we want- clean , central and safe accommodation. That is what we offer.

name: Monastiraki style
description:
In a unique house in Monastiraki flea market and at the entrance to acropolis at 1st floor of 50s building ,a big private room with two single beds decorated in greek traditional style .Next to room is a big kitchen and big bathroom .Both are shared with another one room .You can enjoy the energy and viewing acropolis hill from rooftop.Is an expirience to stay in my house.

host_about: Im living and work in historical area. name: Konstantinos' resting place for travelers
description:
The studio is air-conditioned, weelchair-accessible, and can accommodate up to three persons.
Very close to Heroon Square (Psirri) and Monastiraki, 3 min. from the metro with direct access to the airport.
It has two toilets, washing-machine, steam ironing device, refrigerator and basic kitchen equipment. The Smart TV is available after nine o'clock at the evening and during the weekends.
At the patio is the smoking place and pets can be accommodate with the responsibility of the guests
neighborhood_overview:
The studio is located at the Historical Centre of Athens, at the most alive neighborhood, in one of the most beautiful streets of the contemporary city.
The Vintage mood has turned a traditional area to a modern way of living!
host_about: Born in Arcadia, Greece, and traveled around the world. Based at Athens now with the wish to be able to offer back what has been gained through travelling!

name: IN FRONT OF METRO AND ACROPOLIS! DIRECT TO AIRPORT
description: AMAZING VIEW OF ACROPOLIS, which is super close to the house! Totally central point in Athens "EXACTLY IN FRONT OF METRO STATION KERAMEIKOS(Gazi)", the heart of night life in Athens.ONLY ONE METRO STOP from Monastiraki and Acropolis. Kerameikos metro line is DIRECT TO THE AIRPORT (you take blue line of metro from airport and you stop in front of my house).Kerameikos or Gazi square is 24 hours area full of restaurants,caffees and bars. And one of the safest areas in real Athens historical centre
neighborhood_overview: The house is in front of metro station of Kerameikos(Gkazi),the heart of night life in Athens. Gazi is full of caffees,bars and restaurants and also maybe the safest area of Athens,because it is 24 h area. You can go for drink or food any time. Kerameikos metro station is DIRECT to the airport. So it is extremely easy very central area in the real historic Athens centre, for someone who wants to arrive without changing buses and metros. The metro leaves just in front of my house. Monastiraki square is 8 minutes walking(1 minute by metro). Syntagma square is 15 minutes walking(2 minutes by metro).You can easily go to Acropolis and Acropolis museum (20 minutes walking) or 2 minutes by metro.Easy access in any area of Athens. The neighbourhood is very safe!!!
host_about: Hey I’m  Chris. Travelling and meeting new people and cultures is my passion, so i decided to transform my space in an attractive and cozy space for hosting your own trip to Greece! I love meeting new people, so i am looking forward to meet you too and make your stay in Athens an unforgettable experience!

name: 80sqm penthouse in Athens center
description: Fully equipped renovated appartment in the center of Athens, near Pedion Areos in Kipseli.
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is on the fifth floor of a 60's classic apartment building in Kipseli. It is located very close to Fokionos Negri which is full of beautiful coffee shops, restaurants, bars and other shops. You can have a nice stroll there too. Kanari Square is also very close. The Museum of Athens is also nearby, approximately 15-20 minutes on foot, next to Polytechneio on 28th October str.

name: Central Lycabettus view, pr. bath & pr living area
description: Welcome to my central, sunny place, located in Neapoli, 10 min from Lycabetus hill and from one of the most vibrant areas in Athens, and only a half an hour walk to the historic center and the archaeological sites, with an easy access to the metro network and other public transport services. The apartment, with private bathroom for the guests, offers a great view of the city, and Acropolis view from the roof. Your bedroom and your private living area have balconies, where smoking is allowed.
neighborhood_overview: Starting from my apartment, you can have a walk on Lycabetus hill or in its woods, to find an amazing view of the whole Attiki metropolitan area on top of it. To the center of Exarchia, which is a bohemian neighborhood with plenty of taverns, cafes, bars and entertainment, it is a 10 mins walk, to Syntagma square 20 mins, half an hour to the old town "Plaka", and from there another 10 mins up to the Acropolis. You can see also my guide book on my listing.
host_about: Hello! I am a translator, I translate german literature into greek. I would be delighted to be your host and make you feel comfortable in my place. I know my city very well and I can help you with many tips and directions about many interesting and no touristic areas of Athens...

name: PRIVATE Room  in  Monastiraki  center
description:
At 1st floor 50s building big sunny private room with balconies in pedestrian flea market part of Monastiraki .This room has double bed soft matress and is decorated with antiques and collectives keeping the traditional style of Monastiraki popular for it .
Toilet and kitchen and a part of rooftop are shared with other guests or host. .Stairs drives you at 1st floor and part of rooftop is shared with other guests .
neighborhood_overview:
Monastiraki and Plaka are the places you have to visit coming in Athens .Under Acopolis hill and the main market of Athens .Are pedestrian areas keeping the greek traditional style and you get in touch with it.
The house is at the border in pedestrian part at the entrance to ancient agora and in flea market part of Monastiraki .
Is an alive area with plenty of restaurantrs coffeshops and shops .

name: cozy and artistic apartment
description:
The apartment is shared with one private room. It is located in Gizi, a quiet neighborhood very close to the center of Athens. It is ideal for lone travelers (not for male), for couples and for families with one child, for Erasmus students and even for people who visit Athens for business.
Access to the center is really easy, on foot, or with means of transport. Supermarkets, groceries and restaurants are next to the house.
Sometimes in the year our small dog Sahir is in the apartment too.
neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood, Gizi, is a quiet one. Working people live here, middle class, families. It is a safe neighborhood. Gizi is near the National Archeological Museum, near the Epigraphic Museum and others. There are three parks near the house, the one, Evelpidon Park, is a minute far, the second one is like 5 minutes from here and the other, Pedion tou Areos, one of the biggest parks in Athens, is 10 minutes from the house.
There is a square, Gizi square, 3 minutes walking distance, with cafes and Grills. There are also many supermarkets in the area, and bakeries, and ATMs really close to the apartment.
host_about:
I am an artist, I like everything around art, and lately I make jewelry.
I like traveling and conversations in coffee time, I am interested in politics, I talk a lot through the phone and I eat all of my food! And I also cook very good Greek meals!
Life motto: We will see..

neighborhood_overview:
This is considered a very safe neighborhood.

The apartment could really not be more central, it is located between Monastiraki and Syntagma squares ; it is on a street which runs parallel to Ermou, Athens's commercial, pedestrian street.

Whether you are interested in shopping, the arts, culture, historical sites, or want to explore Athens's night scene, you will be able to walk EVERYWHERE from the apartment.

There is a selection of coffee shops right at the bottom of the building, as well as wine bars and places to eat. There is a supermarket seconds away.

name: Private room in a Stylish Penthouse Acropolis VIEW
description:
Comfortable and cosy PRIVATE ROOM with a SHARED BATHROOM in a luxurious penthouse where you will have the unique opportunity to stay with locals which is the real AirBnB's concept.
Your stay in Athens will be unique and unforgettable.
My brand new flat has stunning ACROPOLIS VIEWS exactly like in the pictures.
NOTE:
My listing follows all the cleaning protocols suggested by the new Airbnb cleanliness standards to offer you a safe stay and peace of mind.
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in Neos Kosmos, a very central neighbourhood only a few minutes to the main attractions (Ex. Acropolis about 10 minutes walking) and well-connected with means of transportation. The neighbourhood is pretty quite, safe and full of traditional tavernas, bakeries, supermarkets, cafes and much more.
host_about:
I am Italian/Brazilian working as a photographer and tour guide in Athens. I studied between London and Greece, then decided to settle in Athens since 2013. 
My true passion in life is travelling and meeting people from all over the world. I am a real passionate traveller, it's in my DNA.
When I first came to Athens, I literally fell in love with its beauty, history, people. 
Athens is an open air museum, a city full of taste, authentic traditions and sunny people. I would be more than happy to show you the most authentic places and secrets of this wonderful city, the birth place of western civilisation. Art, music, photography, concerts, the best places where to eat, ancient sacred places...
You can either ask me for tips of join me in one of my walking tours.

Definitely, while staying at my place, you will have the best Italian/Brazilian/Greek hospitality ever.

name: IV.Hip studio apartment in downtown Athens
description:
Welcome at Hip studio!
It is a clean, cozy, modern studio that can cost up to 4 persons.
It is fully equipped with new furniture and electric appliances. Located next to Karitsi Square, between Panepistimio and Syntagma metro station, on a lively and safe neighborhood with restaurants, shops and bars, it can be the starting point for exploring the city. Its colours are reminding of the Greek islands that is why it feels so relaxing staying here. Be the first ones to discover its serene allure!
neighborhood_overview:
What do you have in mind when you think about Athens? Culture? Nightlife? Shopping? this apartment can be a starting point for all of your city explorations. The most important things to see in Athens are within walking distance: Acropolis and, at its feet, the traditional neighborhood of Plaka, Monastiraki, the National Gardens, Ermou Street shopping area, Kolonaki, The Temple of Olympian Zeus, the Panathenaic Stadium.
The apartment is located 440 meters from the Syntagma metro station and the bus service linking the region to the north, south, east suburbs and Piraeus. Quite near, there are many car rental companies, banks, drug stores, supermarkets, bakeries but also bars and restaurants
host_about: We are a group of people Maria, Katerina, Ilias and John that love the city of Athens and travelling. We had a vision about a 1950s building in the heart of Athens ready to be reborn. The result of the combination of these two forces are this hip and elegant apartments in the center of the city that are currently fully renovated and hosting their visitors since the beginning of July 2016.

name: The Parthenon Observatory apt.
description:
Private room in a classic athenian apartment located in the historical district in the very center of the city. Sunlit and quiet place with a view on Acropolis, National Observatory and Lycabettus. The district has numerous cozy bars, restaurants, cultural meeting points and historical sites.
Served by the local metro station which links the neighbourhood with the Pireaus port (15') and the Athens airport (45').
Check in/out times are flexible and depend on the needs of me and my guests.
neighborhood_overview: Thiseio or Thissio (Greek: Θησείο) is the name of a traditional neighborhood in downtown Athens, Greece, northwest of the Acropolis, 1.5 km southwest of downtown. Long ago, the name was derived from the Temple of Hephaestus. The area has many cafés and cultural meeting points. Thissio is surrounded by hills, heights and historical sites which are within a walking distance. The Ancient Agora of Athens, Stoa of Attalos, the Temple of Hephaestus and Kerameikos Archaeological Museum can be entered from Thissio. All others: the National Observatory of Athens, Acropolis of Athens, Philopappos Monument, Mouseion Hill, Pnyx, which is considered the birthplace of Democracy and the Mount Lycabettus can be easily reached or viewed from Thiseio. The panoramic views of them and their natural surroundings from the Areopagus height are spectacular, especially by night.

name: Central,10 minutes from metro, bohemian area...
description: The apartment is located in the center of the city, only 5 minutes from the metro station. Apart from the bedroom it has a dining room where you can have dinner or breakfast, and in the living room is a sofa and desk by the window, that has a view. 5 minutes from my flat are two hills, the Strefi Hill and Lycabettus, which has cable car to go up and have a fantastic view of Athens and Piraeus. In the area you can find many cafes, taverns and bars. Also very close is the Arhaeological Museum.
neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood of Exarcheia is in the city center, considered the avant - garde, because the region has many neoclassical buildings. Also has many universities around, and so many youth stays around. The many cafes around the Exarcheia square are always full of students. Those I love the most are the open-air cinemas where you can watch movies under the open sky, and have a drink. Also there are many bookstores with tables here, you can read a book while you drink your coffee or your aperitif.

name: II. Happy chic apartment in the heart of the city
description:
Welcome at Happy chic apartment!
It is ideal for a family, a group of friends or a couple. Τhe location of the apartment is just magnificent as you can literally touch the heart of Athens (Acropolis, Plaka, Syntagma, Thisseion etc). It is fully equipped with new furniture and electric appliances. Its colours and lighting make an ideal cozy relaxing atmosphere! Situated on a lively and safe neighborhood, between Panepistimio and Syntagma metro station, it is an apartment not to be missed!
neighborhood_overview:
What do you have in mind when you think about Athens? Culture? Nightlife? Shopping? this apartment can be a starting point for all of your city explorations. The most important things to see in Athens are within walking distance: Acropolis and, at its feet, the traditional neighborhood of Plaka, Monastiraki, the National Gardens, Ermou Street shopping area, Kolonaki, The Temple of Olympian Zeus, the Panathenaic Stadium.
The apartment is located 440 meters from the Syntagma metro station and the bus service linking the region to the north, south, east suburbs and Piraeus. Quite near, there are many car rental companies, banks, drug stores, supermarkets, bakeries but also bars and restaurants.
host_about: We are a group of people Maria, Katerina, Ilias and John that love the city of Athens and travelling. We had a vision about a 1950s building in the heart of Athens ready to be reborn. The result of the combination of these two forces are this hip and elegant apartments in the center of the city that are currently fully renovated and hosting their visitors since the beginning of July 2016.

The most important things to see in Athens are within walking distance: Acropolis and, at its feet, the traditional neighborhood of Plaka, Monastiraki, the National Gardens, Ermou Street shopping area, Kolonaki, The Temple of Olympian Zeus, the Panathenaic Stadium.
The apartment is located 440 meters from the Syntagma metro station and the bus service linking the region to the north, south, east suburbs and Piraeus. Quite near, there are many car rental companies, banks, drug stores, supermarkets, bakeries but also bars and restaurants.
host_about: We are a group of people Maria, Katerina, Ilias and John that love the city of Athens and travelling. We had a vision about a 1950s building in the heart of Athens ready to be reborn. The result of the combination of these two forces are this hip and elegant apartments in the center of the city that are currently fully renovated and hosting their visitors since the beginning of July 2016.

neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to Koukaki, a vibrant and charming neighborhood in Athens, the perfect base for your unforgettable Greek adventure. Situated near the iconic Acropolis, Koukaki offers a delightful blend of ancient history, modern amenities, and authentic local experiences.

Stroll through the quaint, tree-lined streets adorned with colorful street art, and immerse yourself in the warmth and hospitality of the local community. Discover a variety of stylish cafés, traditional tavernas, and trendy bars where you can savor mouth-watering Greek cuisine and sip on local wines or refreshing cocktails.

Koukaki is renowned for its cultural treasures, with numerous art galleries, museums, and historic sites within easy reach. Explore the nearby Acropolis Museum and immerse yourself in the rich history of ancient Greece. A short walk takes you to the magnificent Parthenon, where you can marvel at the architectural masterpiece that has stood the test of time.

name: Evaggelismos Private, bedroom, bathroom, balcony
description: An independent, completely private room with a fridge and its own hallway, bathroom, and small balcony, in the nicest and safest area of Athens city centre, opposite Hilton hotel and two minutes walking distance from Evangelismos metro station. Your living area, newly and tastefully renovated, has access from a common entrance hall to my appartment, but is otherwise secluded. from the rest of the house.
neighborhood_overview: Kolonaki is considered an upscaled area, a wonderful, sophisticated cosmopolitan neighbourhood full of nice little bars, cafes, restaurants, art galleries, museums, a shopping district, very safe, close to the historic centre (one metro station or 15 minutes walk from Syntagma square). It is an urban living area, so it is not packed with tourists, very popular to Athenians. It is located below Lycabettus hill, where you can go up with a small "train" and have one of the nicest views of Athens. It is also very convenient for people who are coming to Athens to visit or escort their family members in the nearby hospitals (Evangelismos, Nimits, NNA, Ippokrateio, Agios Savvas), or foreign exchange students, as both the American and English school are within walking distance.
host_about:
I am a happy Athenian who has traveled a lot and has spent many years abroad as a student both in Vienna Austria and the United States of America, I feel at home all over the planet, and everywhere I go I try to see the bright side which always exists
I love animals and have 2 dogs & 2 cats. At the moment I work as a recruiter. Looking forward to hosting you!

name: Luxurious Apartment in Athens (Kolonaki) No3
description:
Our cosy and comfortable one bedroom apartment has a true city feeling. It comfortably fits up to 4 persons and is centrally located with easy access to all major attractions of the city.
-300 meters away from "Panepistimio" metro station
-200 meters away of "The Athenian Trilogy" (Univercity of Athens, Athens Academy,Natioanal Library)
neighborhood_overview:
The famous cosmopolitan neighbourhood of Kolonaki is the place that you have to be in Athens in order to have a clue of the genuine athenian life....Full of young people with wonderful cafes, restaurants and bars.
For your shopping visit The Attika Mall of Athens (300meters away) .
The direct neighborhood is quiet, safe, friendly and practical with most commodities (supermarkets, pharmacies, banks, buses, taxis, cafes, reastaurants etc).

name: Modern big room in downtown apartment in Exarcheia
description:
The 65 sq.meters' apartment has been fully renovated in 2022. The bedroom has a comfortable double bed, an aircondition, a large 3-sheet wardrobe and a built-in sofa below the window. Apart from the window there is also a small balcony with plants and flowers. There are two bedside tables and several sockets for charging all devices.

The door to the room locks both from the inside and outside.
neighborhood_overview: Restaurants, bars and nice cafes with beautiful backyards and terraces are all within short walking distance. Every Saturday there is a colourful market with local produce, fish, fruits, vegetables and flowers in Kallidromiou street, 2 min from the flat, where guests can do their shopping and also enjoy a coffee or a drink with locals to feel the exarchian spirit. A visit is highly recommended. A big supermarket for your shopping is 3 min walk. Two open air cinemas (Riviera in Exarcheia and Dexameni in Lycabettus) are also very close. Guests can follow the staircases and climb up to the top of Lycabettus hill, the highest part in the city centre, which offers a beautiful pine forest, many trails to walk or run and impressive views of the Attica basin, from Acropolis to the Saronic gulf.

name: Thiseio 1915 - Aegle  open-plan elegant studio
description:
Experience a warm hospitality in one of the most privileged locations in the absolute heart of the historic centre of Athens. In the neighborhood of Thiseio, at the backyard part of our completely renovated neoclassical bulding named "Thiseio 1915", lays the elegantly and modern furnished "Aegle" studio. This
studio together with the other two home apartments "Harmonia" and "Erato" offer our quests a hidden gateway, a microcosm of serenity in the turbulence of the outside world.
neighborhood_overview: The Location Advantage! The residence is located in the heart of the historic centre of Athens, at the neighborhood of Thiseio few meters away from Apostolou Pavlou pedestrian street. Shopping areas, restaurants, cafes, entertainment venues, museums & monuments are within walking distance. Choosing the "Thiseio 1915-Aegle" studio for your quality stay in Athens you can also enjoy walks along ancient monuments in the network of paths formed by the nearby hills of Filopappou, Nymphs and Pnyx.
host_about:
Welcome to Thiseio 1915 !! 
Our team, Giannis, Theano, Nadia & Fani are looking forward to welcome you at Harmonia, Erato and Aegle apartments in a completely renovated building of neoclassical architecture, in the heart of Athens' historical center.
With particular care, we have created a lodging for Athens’ urban explorers, business travelers, holiday weekenders, ageless couples and city break enthusiasts.
We remain at your disposal !

name: Hera Junior Suite
description: Hera Junior Suite
host_about:
Hi ! Im Chris! I 'm the owner of 9 apartments in the centre (Email hidden by Airbnb) and my team  love the city we live and had a vision to create Hellenic Houses with artistry and show the traditional Greek Hospitality to friends from every part of the world.You are all welcome and we are ready to accommodate you in our five clean and cosy  Hellenic Houses in order  to experience the way of our life, staying in Athens.
Hellenic Houses are located on the Aiolou Street, a pedestrian street with street vendors, musicians, shops and cuisine from all parts of the world. We want to introduce you to graphic small alleys, taverns with unique Greek flavors, multicultural bars and help you navigate seamlessly the archaeological sites, museums and ancient Athens.

name: Theo Homeybee Exarcheia Apt No10-Room 1
description:
Hello Homey!

Cute and cosy 1th-floor private room in a two room apartment in Exarchia, one of the most prominent urban neighbourhoods in the heart of Athens. Being close to public transport stations (metro, bus, railway), yet in walking-distance from a variety of historic landmarks and must-see places in the city, it offers an ideal accommodation for individual travelers and loving couples as well.
neighborhood_overview:
A truly boheme neighbourhood in the heart of Athens.
Historic urban neighbourhood, one of the last authentic and unspoiled in Europe. Famous for its artistic essence and boheme aura, it is mostly inhabited and frequented by artists, musicians, writers, actors and creative minds. Low-paced daily routine, yet with plenty of nightlife choices, the neighbourhood will make you fall in love with the youthful urban lifestyle, from relaxing cafeterias and lively art spaces to alternative bars and picturesque restaurants. Pedion Areos Park and Lycabettus Hill are also great options for your morning walks, or even workouts - in case you’re the active type of person!
host_about:
Hello, I'm Theo.
  I live in the neighborhood of Exarcheia and I deal exclusively with the short-term rental of my privately owned apartments, so I have the opportunity to have discreet but direct contact with my guests and I will be very happy to help your smooth stay in Athens.
  I live very close to all my apartments and, as I am fully committed to the convenience and care of my guests' accommodation, I am always happy to meet new people and share local tips and "inside information" of the city.

  During the summer, I am also happy to have my guests at home for coffee or a drink - my house has a wonderful terrace with stunning views of Lycabettus, the Parthenon and the cityscape of Athens.  You'll love it!  In any other case, you will probably meet  coffee of the Exarcheion say hello and have a raki with me!

  We hope to see you soon!

name: Acropolis Studio, a small apartment in a loft
description: The house is located about 500 meters from Dionysiou Areopagitou Pedestrian Street, the longest walkway in Athens, which starts from Thission, passes in front of the Odeon of Herodes Atticus with the Parthenon proudly standing above, and finally gets you to the New Acropolis Museum and the ancient Temple of Olympian Zeus at the end of the street.
neighborhood_overview:
Ano Petralona is a tranquil and beautiful quarter at the foot of the Philopappou Hill -also called the Hill of the Muses- next to the busy Thission district on the west side of the Acropolis.
The distance to Omonia Square –the capital’s heterogeneous “hub”- is 1,000 meters, via Piraeus Street. The same distance separates our neighborhood from the picturesque Plaka and the Acropolis. Our central square Platia Mercouri, at the beginning of Kallisthenous Street, is a meeting point for the locals with its traditional tavernas and bohemian café hangouts and is said to be the place to be. Multicolored bougainvilleas adorn the streets of Ano Petralona, especially the charming Troon Street.

name: Theo Homeybee Exarcheia Apt Νο8-Room 1
description:
Hello Homey!

Cute and cosy 4th-floor private room in a two room apartment in Exarchia, one of the most prominent urban neighbourhoods in the heart of Athens. Being close to public transport stations (metro, bus, railway), yet in walking-distance from a variety of historic landmarks and must-see places in the city, it offers an ideal accommodation for individual travelers and loving couples as well.
neighborhood_overview:
A truly boheme neighbourhood in the heart of Athens.
Historic urban neighbourhood, one of the last authentic and unspoiled in Europe. Famous for its artistic essence and boheme aura, it is mostly inhabited and frequented by artists, musicians, writers, actors and creative minds. Low-paced daily routine, yet with plenty of nightlife choices, the neighbourhood will make you fall in love with the youthful urban lifestyle, from relaxing cafeterias and lively art spaces to alternative bars and picturesque restaurants. Pedion Areos Park are also great options for your morning walks, or even workouts - in case you’re the active type of person!
host_about:
Hello, I'm Theo.
  I live in the neighborhood of Exarcheia and I deal exclusively with the short-term rental of my privately owned apartments, so I have the opportunity to have discreet but direct contact with my guests and I will be very happy to help your smooth stay in Athens.
  I live very close to all my apartments and, as I am fully committed to the convenience and care of my guests' accommodation, I am always happy to meet new people and share local tips and "inside information" of the city.

  During the summer, I am also happy to have my guests at home for coffee or a drink - my house has a wonderful terrace with stunning views of Lycabettus, the Parthenon and the cityscape of Athens.  You'll love it!  In any other case, you will probably meet  coffee of the Exarcheion say hello and have a raki with me!

  We hope to see you soon!

neighborhood_overview:
Exarchia is a district that is considered a student quarter and a scene meeting place.
The district, which was founded in 1880-1890, is said to have been named after a grocer named Exarchos. The center of the district is the Platia Exarchion. Seamless is the transition to the Schickeria district of Kolonaiki, to which it has an administrative border to the south.
The neighborhood is inhabited by numerous students and artists and is considered the center of the alternative scene. In addition to university institutes, numerous cafés, taverns, pubs and snack bars, but also graffiti-painted house walls characterize the street scene. The area has a lively nightlife with a number of Rembetiko restaurants.
In November 1973, the uprising at the Polytechnic against the rule of the military junta began here, which was bloodily suppressed after a few days.
Today, Exarcheia is still an insider tip.

The Supreme Court,Panathinaikos stadium and the largest city park-Mars Fields are very close to this house.

name: Cozy room in a renovated apartment
description:
The room is part of a spacious, fully equipped, clean and competent apartment, located in the heart of Athens, in Exarcheia. It is easily accessible to public transportation, 10' walking to metro station.
The room is quiet, private and cozy with a window with natural light.
It is really close to Archaeological museum, Lycabettus and Strefis Hill.
Real sense of neighborhood, bookstores, shops, warm cafes and crowded bars, at the historic area of Exarcheia.
neighborhood_overview:
Exarcheia is one of Athens’ oldest neighbourhoods and full of life, mainly due to the University of Athens. Because of Exarcheia's liberal history, many artists choose to live here giving an alternative vibe to the area. In addition to the liberal vibe, Exarcheia is a place of free political and social statement with many collectives supporting among other minority.
This authentic neighbourhood is an architectural maze, packed with bohemian shops, shops with handmade products, organic shops, hidden yards. Here you can explore paved alleys with street art, politically charged murals and some of the most unique shops in Athens. You should absolutely visit the graphic flea market where you can see people from all ages knowing each other and shopping on Saturdays.
host_about:
I am a dancer based in Athens. 
As a local, living in the center of Athens, I would happily advise you where to go, what to see and help you with practical information about Athens.

As an artist, I could also advise you about the artistic and alternative scene of Athens! You will have the chance to enjoy theater, dance, music lives that are not well known, in the most underground spaces of Athens! You will find even places to have pilates, yoga or dance classes!

I love nature and its peacefulness. I like traveling, meeting and socializing with new people! When I don't dance I love reading, cooking and taking care of my plants!

host_about:
Co & Living is a team that helps people relocating to Athens for a while to find their ideal space to live in. Whether you are a student, a young professional, a volunteer or just a visitor in need of short-term accommodation, this is the place for you.

 Our Vision is:
To Create deeper living experience based in-person relationship and rooted with the local community.

To understand the human challenges in urban life and the professional challenges in business field.

We are focused in working with innovative and motivated team in order to become home for our residents & partners.
Therefore our motto is:

Together Is Better

name: Gaia | Superior Room | Two bedrooms with balcony
description: Where the comforts of home meet the local stylish influences of the central Psirri neighborhood - GAIA offers a stay like no other for travelers looking to experience real Greece, and live the local way! With our newly renovated rooms, guests are invited to immerse themselves in Athens’ culture with all the necessary amenities at their disposal. Take in the electrifying Psirri atmosphere from your balcony and enjoy a relaxing evening in your spacious Superior Room, ideal for groups and families.
neighborhood_overview:
In a central area of Athens, Gaia is 300 m from Ermou Street-Shopping Area. Popular points of interest nearby include Monastiraki Flea Market and Monastiraki Square. Free WiFi is available and Ancient Agora of Athens is 400 m away.
Roman Agora is 601 m from Gaia Rooms & Apartments. The nearest airport is Elefthérios Venizélos Airport, 12 mi from the accommodations.
host_about:
Kalimera, I’m Alex, and welcome to Athens! At Gaia, we encourage our guests to enjoy what the real Greece has to offer and we want to show you that the local way is the only way!

Being Greek, family and hospitality is deeply rooted within our culture, and is at the heart of everything we do here at Gaia. We want our guests to feel right at home in our wonderful city, and however long your stay, we promise to make it a truly enjoyable authentic Greek experience; come and discover what it means to live the local way!

Guests’ safety and comfort is at the top of our list, and we strive to make sure your stay at Gaia meets all your needs as a home from home - we are proud this summer to offer our guests newly renovated rooms, with optimum comfort in mind. I learnt from a young age the value of hospitality and I understand how important it is to feel at home, more than ever when you are away. Growing up with and working in hospitality, I was inspired by my love of meeting new people, making connections, and most of all, helping these people get the most out of their experiences - so much so, that I have formed a career around the business of making this happen! We want to make sure guests don’t just have a place to stay, but gain as much as they can from their visit to Athens! People come from all parts of the world to visit our amazing city as their chosen holiday destination - it’s my job (and my pleasure!) to help make their experience the best it can possibly be!

Athens to me is home; the people, the kindness shown within the community and to strangers alike - we have an amazing atmosphere here, and it’s one you won’t find anywhere else in the world. Here in Athens we like to have fun, we delight in the old and embrace the new - which you’ll see wherever you walk within the city - the beautiful meeting of Modern and Ancient Greece. A city that has it all, everything for everyone - and so much more than a visit to the Acropolis! I want to share this special connection I have with the city with others, and encourage visitors, both Greek and international, to explore the place I’m proud to call home. Let me show you my Athens! 

Psirri in particular, is the buzzing neighbourhood where you’ll find us (along with the best hangouts and eateries in Athens!) - the Gaia family is proud to be part of a community that represents the very soul of the city. Experience real Greece here; eat what the locals do, drink with us, explore our streets you haven’t read about yet, take a walk through our history, modern and ancient - and live the local way!

Since my family and I began constructing Gaia in 2016, we have worked hard to expand, and are now able to offer more options for our guests seeking independent accommodation within the heart of the city. With our guests’ needs in mind, we’re now managing premium apartments, in the perfect location, which capture the authenticity and spirit of Psyri; you’ll be able to experience the real Athens like a local, with all the amenities you need to feel at home.
 
Gaia was created by family for family - since we started out as a small hotel with only a few rooms open, people have loved staying with us because of our incredible culture of going above and beyond when it comes to hospitality - my family has always lived by this principle, and we welcome all of our guests as we do our own family - we’ll make sure you won’t leave Athens without a full stomach, a story to tell and a promise to come back and visit! We look forward to welcoming you soon!

name: Gaia | King Interior Room | Historical Center
description: Where the comforts of home meet the local stylish influences of the central Psirri neighborhood - GAIA offers a stay like no other for travelers looking to experience real Greece, and live the local way! With our newly renovated rooms, guests are invited to immerse themselves in Athens’ culture with all necessary amenities at their disposal. Sit back on your sofa and soak up the welcoming Psirri atmosphere, in your homely King Interior Room, ideal for individuals and couples.
neighborhood_overview:
We are very fortunate at GAIA to be based in the centre of Athens’ old town, the heart of our modern-ancient capital, where guests will find the likes of the Acropolis, the ancient Roman Agora, the (modern!) central shopping area and many other sites worth visiting only a walk away! If you’re wanting to discover more of Psirri, our buzzing local neighbourhood, and its captivating energy, we recommend stepping out in the evening to explore the best eateries and bars our community (and to be honest, the city) has to offer, and all right at your doorstep! Get yourself ready for a night of authentic non-stop Greek dining and, if you’re brave enough to survive the early hours, Athens’ famous never-ending nightlife!

You’ll find us conveniently located within walking distance from Monastiraki station, and among the best local hangouts in Athens! The Gaia family is proud to be part of a community that represents the very soul of the city - eclectic, lively and on-trend. Experience r
host_about:
Kalimera, I’m Alex, and welcome to Athens! At Gaia, we encourage our guests to enjoy what the real Greece has to offer and we want to show you that the local way is the only way!

Being Greek, family and hospitality is deeply rooted within our culture, and is at the heart of everything we do here at Gaia. We want our guests to feel right at home in our wonderful city, and however long your stay, we promise to make it a truly enjoyable authentic Greek experience; come and discover what it means to live the local way!

Guests’ safety and comfort is at the top of our list, and we strive to make sure your stay at Gaia meets all your needs as a home from home - we are proud this summer to offer our guests newly renovated rooms, with optimum comfort in mind. I learnt from a young age the value of hospitality and I understand how important it is to feel at home, more than ever when you are away. Growing up with and working in hospitality, I was inspired by my love of meeting new people, making connections, and most of all, helping these people get the most out of their experiences - so much so, that I have formed a career around the business of making this happen! We want to make sure guests don’t just have a place to stay, but gain as much as they can from their visit to Athens! People come from all parts of the world to visit our amazing city as their chosen holiday destination - it’s my job (and my pleasure!) to help make their experience the best it can possibly be!

Athens to me is home; the people, the kindness shown within the community and to strangers alike - we have an amazing atmosphere here, and it’s one you won’t find anywhere else in the world. Here in Athens we like to have fun, we delight in the old and embrace the new - which you’ll see wherever you walk within the city - the beautiful meeting of Modern and Ancient Greece. A city that has it all, everything for everyone - and so much more than a visit to the Acropolis! I want to share this special connection I have with the city with others, and encourage visitors, both Greek and international, to explore the place I’m proud to call home. Let me show you my Athens! 

Psirri in particular, is the buzzing neighbourhood where you’ll find us (along with the best hangouts and eateries in Athens!) - the Gaia family is proud to be part of a community that represents the very soul of the city. Experience real Greece here; eat what the locals do, drink with us, explore our streets you haven’t read about yet, take a walk through our history, modern and ancient - and live the local way!

Since my family and I began constructing Gaia in 2016, we have worked hard to expand, and are now able to offer more options for our guests seeking independent accommodation within the heart of the city. With our guests’ needs in mind, we’re now managing premium apartments, in the perfect location, which capture the authenticity and spirit of Psyri; you’ll be able to experience the real Athens like a local, with all the amenities you need to feel at home.
 
Gaia was created by family for family - since we started out as a small hotel with only a few rooms open, people have loved staying with us because of our incredible culture of going above and beyond when it comes to hospitality - my family has always lived by this principle, and we welcome all of our guests as we do our own family - we’ll make sure you won’t leave Athens without a full stomach, a story to tell and a promise to come back and visit! We look forward to welcoming you soon!

description:
Room Size 23 m²
Fitted with parquet floors and well-chosen furnishings, this elegantly decorated studio opens to a balcony. It has a kitchenette and comes equipped with a flat-screen TV, air conditioning, free WiFi and safe. It includes a private, modern bathroom with walk-in shower or shower cabin.

neighborhood_overview: Offering the best location to stay in Athens, Greece, Estia boutique apartments provide the perfect starting point for your city excursions. Set in the historic residential areas of Metaxourgeio and Kerameikos, Estia boutique apartments offer you an abundance of places to visit and things to do in Athens. Visit the Pinacoteca, the coffee shops, local taverns and bars, take a walk on the pedestrian roads and marvel the impressive neoclassical buildings. Head to the Parthenon and the Acropolis Museum, the Temple of Olympian Zeus and the Odeon of Herodes Atticus. Step back in time at the Byzantine & Christian Museum, the Benaki Museum and the National Archeological Museum. Stroll through the ancient agora, take pictures at the Temple of Poseidon, the theatre of Dionysos, the National Gardens and Hardian’s Arch. Observe the changing of the guards at the Parliament building on Syntagma square and marvel the temple of Athena Nike. Visit the Propylaia, the Temple of Hephaistos, the Stavros Ni
host_about: Estia boutique apartments in Athens was inspired by Hestia, the Greek goddess of the Home and just like her name suggests it offers a home away from home filled with warmth and a sense of familiarity. A home oozing heritage, style and comfort reflecting the glories, the beauties and unceasing spirit of the land.

Everything you are looking for is around you!

Just a few meters away from Syntagma Square, where the heart of Athens beats, located is the Enattica Syntagma Living. Modern and comfortable rooms are waiting for you to enjoy memorable moments, offering you a break from the rhythms of the city.

For a business trip or a stopover in the city of Athens, Enattica Syntagma Living is the ideal destination for you as its location in the city center offers a variety of options for your vacation. The access to Enattica Syntagma Living is quite easy, as with the Syntagma Metro stop just 750 meters away, you can easily move comfortably and quickly to and from the accommodation to the nearby areas.

name: Ancient Agora - Athens 33
description:
"Athens 33" is located at 33 Kapnikareas Str.. at Palea Agora square, Plaka/Athens.
It is a newly renovated building in November 2018, which comprises of 6 beautiful bigger and smaller independent apartments. Everything has been made with emphasis on detail and functionality. The property itself is in the most beautiful area of Athens, Plaka, with great history, shopping and excellent dining and nightlife.
neighborhood_overview: Plaka is the historical area of Athens with great shopping, dining and nightlife. A truly enjoyable place to stay in Athens, close to museums, monuments, theaters, restaurants and bars.

name: Large stylish room in gorgeous Plaka apartment
description: This new flat located in the heart of Athens has been holistically refurbished and tastefully furnished and is the ideal space to host a short stay in the city centre for international travelers, laid back couples, adventurous friends or longer stays for lovers of this vibrant city (*single women or couples only please, no single males*). In the heart of Athens, nestled between Syntagma and Plaka, the flat overlooks the expansive Mitropoleos Square and the 12th century church of Gorgoepikoos
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is situated in the cultural and historic centre, where you will be always be a stone's throw from all that you want to see during your stay in Athens. On the one side of Mitropoleos Square is the entrance to Plaka, the renowed spiritual and cultural capital of Athens and home to old quaint residences, charming storefronts, bountiful restaurants and museums. Hillside Plaka has a village feel, with narrow cobblestone streets lined with tiny shops selling jewelry, clothes and local ceramics. Family-run tavernas stay open until late, and open-air cinemas show art house
movies al fresco. Nearby, the whitewashed homes of the Anafiotika neighborhood give the small enclave a Greek-island vibe.

On the other side of the square is Mitropoleos Street which connects the renowned Syntagma (Constitution) Square and the Parliament with Monastiraki square and its flea markets/shopping district. Besides all the main touristic attractions which are immediately accesible, yo
host_about: Of Greek-Cypriot and British extraction, I was born and raised in Athens where I attended an international school with over 40 nationalities. For my university studies I moved to Washington DC and later lived in New York, Melbourne and travelled all over the world. After completing my masters in London I settled back in Athens. An avid reader, certified yoga teacher and committed environmentalist I am happy when surrounded with people who share a love for life, a respect for the mother gaia and an affinity to social justice.

name: Theo Homeybee Exarcheia Apt No10-Room 2
description:
Hello Homey!

Cute and cosy 1th-floor private room in a two room apartment in Exarchia, one of the most prominent urban neighbourhoods in the heart of Athens. Being close to public transport stations (metro, bus, railway), yet in walking-distance from a variety of historic landmarks and must-see places in the city, it offers an ideal accommodation for individual travelers and loving couples as well.
neighborhood_overview:
A truly boheme neighbourhood in the heart of Athens.
Historic urban neighbourhood, one of the last authentic and unspoiled in Europe. Famous for its artistic essence and boheme aura, it is mostly inhabited and frequented by artists, musicians, writers, actors and creative minds. Low-paced daily routine, yet with plenty of nightlife choices, the neighbourhood will make you fall in love with the youthful urban lifestyle, from relaxing cafeterias and lively art spaces to alternative bars and picturesque restaurants. Pedion Areos Park and Lycabettus Hill are also great options for your morning walks, or even workouts - in case you’re the active type of person!
host_about:
Hello, I'm Theo.
  I live in the neighborhood of Exarcheia and I deal exclusively with the short-term rental of my privately owned apartments, so I have the opportunity to have discreet but direct contact with my guests and I will be very happy to help your smooth stay in Athens.
  I live very close to all my apartments and, as I am fully committed to the convenience and care of my guests' accommodation, I am always happy to meet new people and share local tips and "inside information" of the city.

  During the summer, I am also happy to have my guests at home for coffee or a drink - my house has a wonderful terrace with stunning views of Lycabettus, the Parthenon and the cityscape of Athens.  You'll love it!  In any other case, you will probably meet  coffee of the Exarcheion say hello and have a raki with me!

  We hope to see you soon!

name: Private room in Pangrati apartment (Room B, 392)
description: If you are looking for a place to stay long-term or short-term, I am sure the room will fit your needs. The apartment is in a key location, close to the center but also far enough to avoid the intense car sounds and grey of the city. It's a 15 minutes walk away from the Syntagma metro station and a 10 minutes walk from Euagelismos metro station. There are a lot of green spaces close to the apartment, like a park which is next to it, the hill of Kalimarmaro Stadium and also the National Garden.
neighborhood_overview: Pangrati has become very trendy the past few years. There are more and more places opening the past year so feel free to ask if you are looking for something in particular.
host_about:
Hello!
My name is Orfeas Voutsinos-Frantzis.
I am a PhD student at the Agricultural University of Athens. I study the plant "cichorium spinosum" in different agricultural systems, from organic open field to vertical farms. I also am the co-founder of the Dutch-based startup "Farmvent" (Website hidden by Airbnb)  that focuses on vertical farming solutions.

I will be staying in the same apartment as you will.
There are 3 bedrooms in the apartment and I stay in one of them. You might meet another airbnb guest staying at the other room at the time of your stay.

I honestly enjoy meeting you guys. It's like doing erasmus from home in a way. I met a lot of interesting people throughout the years I've been doing airbnb and I became good friends with some of you. I apologize in advance  in case we meet in period where I am undergoing a lot of work-related pressure and I am not that socially active. I do enjoy when people enjoy the environment of the apartment.

I look forward to meeting you

Supermarkets, bakery open 24h, travel agencies and many services just below the house. I live in the house i've customized it with my silk batiks and lamps creating a blue atmosphere reminding the soft colours of the greek sea. There's also a space with a big table to work .
I'm at your disposal to suggest places to visit , near the house the Archeological Museum.Bathroom and kitchen sharing.
neighborhood_overview: the Archeological museum is very near and also a big park called "Pedion to Ares", a lots of coffe bar and restaurants around the house will served you typical greek specialities, and also a small greek club opening saurday and sunday.
host_about:
Desidero accogliere coloro che vorranno passare da Bologna ed alloggiare "da nonno" nel miglior modo possibile. Vivo in questa che era la casa di mio nonno, nella quale ho trascorso l'infanzia tra tortellini e pere di prosciutto crudo ed ora ,da adulta, l'ho personalizzata con lampade , tende, ed arazzi in seta dipinti a mano realizzati da me con tecnica batik.
Sono infatti un'artigiana e mi sono divertita a rivisitare la casa del nonno mettendo a frutto la mia conoscenza, apro le porte agli ospiti che verranno perchè così me la ricordo, molto ben frequentata.

name: Theo Homeybee Exarcheia Apt No8-Room 2
description: No disponible
neighborhood_overview:
A truly boheme neighbourhood in the heart of Athens.
Historic urban neighbourhood, one of the last authentic and unspoiled in Europe. Famous for its artistic essence and boheme aura, it is mostly inhabited and frequented by artists, musicians, writers, actors and creative minds. Low-paced daily routine, yet with plenty of nightlife choices, the neighbourhood will make you fall in love with the youthful urban lifestyle, from relaxing cafeterias and lively art spaces to alternative bars and picturesque restaurants. Pedion Areos Park and Lycabettus Hill are also great options for your morning walks, or even workouts - in case you’re the active type of person!
host_about:
Hello, I'm Theo.
  I live in the neighborhood of Exarcheia and I deal exclusively with the short-term rental of my privately owned apartments, so I have the opportunity to have discreet but direct contact with my guests and I will be very happy to help your smooth stay in Athens.
  I live very close to all my apartments and, as I am fully committed to the convenience and care of my guests' accommodation, I am always happy to meet new people and share local tips and "inside information" of the city.

  During the summer, I am also happy to have my guests at home for coffee or a drink - my house has a wonderful terrace with stunning views of Lycabettus, the Parthenon and the cityscape of Athens.  You'll love it!  In any other case, you will probably meet  coffee of the Exarcheion say hello and have a raki with me!

  We hope to see you soon!

name: athens.apartotel.box
description: Small room - apartment (11sq.m.) in the center of Athens, with easy access to Monastiraki metro station. It can accommodate up to 2 guests with 1 double bed and includes private wc/shower, WiFi, TV, a/c, safe box, security door.
neighborhood_overview:
Athens is a beautiful city with a rich history and culture. It is the capital of Greece and one of the most popular destinations in the world. The city offers a unique combination experience of ancient and modern culture.

Close to your home, you'll find several attractions worth visiting. These include:

1. Stoa of Attalos - Museum of the Ancient Agora: A restored ancient temple that today serves as a museum, offering a unique opportunity to explore the archaeology of the area.

2. Little Kook: A magical space that takes you into a fantastic world of fairy tales and happy moments.

3. Museum of the City of Athens - Vouros-Eftaxi Foundation: A museum that hosts a collection of objects that reflect the history and culture of the city of Athens.

4. Korai 4 | Memorial Site 1941-1944: A place of remembrance commemorating the victims of the Nazi occupation in Athens during World War II.

5. Museum of Greek Folk Musical Instruments

Akropolis is only 0,5 km, Erechteio 0,5 km, Parthenon 0,6 km, Odion Herodou Attikou 0,7 km, Roman Agora is 0,25 km from the apartment, while Anafiotika is 0,5 km away. The nearest airport is Elefthérios Venizélos Airport, 32 km from Aiolos Apartments Ermou 64.

name: Art Deco Apartment in Kypseli
description: This is a newly rennovated Art Deco space in Kypseli, downtown Athens. It is located on St George's square, one of the city's most vibrant areas with bars, tavernas and a young, multicultural population. It is easily accessible by subway, train and trolley bus and a walking distance away from important sites and areas such as the Archaeological Museum, Exarchia, Omonoia sq.
neighborhood_overview: Kypseli is amazing! It is Athens' most diverse, multicultural neighborhood with bars, coffee shops and little tavernas around, as well as cinemas and theatres at walking distance. The space is located across the street from a supermarket ,and the trolley bus that takes you to Syntagma is outside our door. We are also few minutes away from Kypseli Municipal Market that always has some fun events going on.
host_about: I am a performing artist originally from Greece currently living and working in NYC. Before NYC I lived in Toronto Canada for 7 years where I did grad school in theater studies. I have grown up in Athens and I have spent beautiful summers in the south of Greece, in that specific house which I love and call home. Since I am away most of the year I want to make the house available to guests who will appreciate an authentic simple country life style, mingle with the locals and enjoy the wonderful nature and sites.

name: Theo Homeybee Omonoia Victoria Apt No11-Room 1
description:
Hello Homey!

Cute and cosy 3rd-floor private room in a two room apartment right next to Exarchia, one of the most prominent urban neighbourhoods in the heart of Athens. Being close to public transport stations (metro, bus, railway), yet in walking-distance from a variety of historic landmarks and must-see places in the city, it offers an ideal accommodation for individual travelers and loving couples as well.
neighborhood_overview:
A truly boheme neighbourhood in the heart of Athens.
Historic urban neighbourhood, one of the last authentic and unspoiled in Europe. Famous for its artistic essence and boheme aura, it is mostly inhabited and frequented by artists, musicians, writers, actors and creative minds. Low-paced daily routine, yet with plenty of nightlife choices, the neighbourhood will make you fall in love with the youthful urban lifestyle, from relaxing cafeterias and lively art spaces to alternative bars and picturesque restaurants. Pedion Areos Park and Lycabettus Hill are also great options for your morning walks, or even workouts - in case you’re the active type of person!
host_about:
Hello, I'm Theo.
  I live in the neighborhood of Exarcheia and I deal exclusively with the short-term rental of my privately owned apartments, so I have the opportunity to have discreet but direct contact with my guests and I will be very happy to help your smooth stay in Athens.
  I live very close to all my apartments and, as I am fully committed to the convenience and care of my guests' accommodation, I am always happy to meet new people and share local tips and "inside information" of the city.

  During the summer, I am also happy to have my guests at home for coffee or a drink - my house has a wonderful terrace with stunning views of Lycabettus, the Parthenon and the cityscape of Athens.  You'll love it!  In any other case, you will probably meet  coffee of the Exarcheion say hello and have a raki with me!

  We hope to see you soon!

name: cozy room close to the centre
description:
The apartment is shared and we provide you 1 private room. It is located in Gizi, a quiet neighborhood very close to the center of Athens. It is ideal for lone travelers , for Erasmus students and even for people who visit Athens for business.
Access to the center is really easy, on foot, or with means of transport. Supermarkets, groceries and restaurants are next to the house.
Sometimes in the year our small dog Sahir is in the apartment too.
neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood, Gizi, is a quiet one. Working people live here, middle class, families. It is a safe neighborhood. Gizi is near the National Archeological Museum, near the Epigraphic Museum and others. There are three parks near the house, the one, Evelpidon Park, is a minute far, the second one is like 5 minutes from here and the other, Pedion tou Areos, one of the biggest parks in Athens, is 10 minutes from the house.
There is a square, Gizi square, 3 minutes walking distance, with cafes and Grills. There are also many supermarkets in the area, and bakeries, and ATMs really close to the apartment.
host_about:
I am an artist, I like everything around art, and lately I make jewelry.
I like traveling and conversations in coffee time, I am interested in politics, I talk a lot through the phone and I eat all of my food! And I also cook very good Greek meals!
Life motto: We will see..

name: brightness room with big private balconi /Kolonaki
description:
Magnificent room in a large House 115 sqm, greek post modernism bauhaous building.
On the first floor with nice balcony private balcony . The apartment is in totally renovated and fully furnished in May 2019.
The metro station is around 10 minutes.
Restorated with paying attention to the original materials and natural flow of the space.
With consideration to the 3 Rs -recycle..reuse..reduce. hope you would enjoy its bohimianstyle.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in the middle of cosmopolital Kolonaki district and anarchist Exarcheia!
Close to the Natioal Archaiological Museum, and near to Pedion Areos one of the nicest natural parks of Athens, ideal for walk and breathtaking views of Athens or for a coffee break in the numerous artistic and vibrant cafés of the area. You are spoilt for choice of the variety of restaurants with traditional and international cuisine (vegan, vegetarian , fusion, greek fast food, great sulvaki) and plenty of night bars. Many events throughtout the year.
host_about:
Co & Living is a team that helps people relocating to Athens for a while to find their ideal space to live in. Whether you are a student, a young professional, a volunteer or just a visitor in need of short-term accommodation, this is the place for you.

 Our Vision is:
To Create deeper living experience based in-person relationship and rooted with the local community.

To understand the human challenges in urban life and the professional challenges in business field.

We are focused in working with innovative and motivated team in order to become home for our residents & partners.
Therefore our motto is:

Together Is Better

Ypu can also check our community space 
 https://www.kinkibbutz.space/

name: Private room in flatshare (#2) *Kato Patissia*
description: Whether you are choosing Athens as an erasmus student, trainee or professional, this huge, centrally located flatshare may be the best affordable solution for accomodation. Bedrooms are on the back, overlooking the backyard from each balcony; in the front, there is a wide living room with marble flooring, decorated with a mix-and-match combination of antiques and modern furniture, as well as access to the big veranda. All rooms are fully equiped and furnished.
neighborhood_overview: Kato Patissia is a colourful, international neighborhood full of small shops and businesses, as well as medical centers and supermarkets. There is a street organic market twice a week where you can buy fruits, vegetables, fresh eggs and non brand clothes.

host_about: I have studied design, literature and theatre and now run a property management company here in Athens.

name: BoHo Boutique Hotel Near Acropolis | Ederlezi Luna
description: The little sister of the bunch, Luna has always questioned all authority, though the others loved her for it. 2 people can stay in this 2nd floor, 20-sq. m. room and Luna welcomes them with all the amenities custom to Ederlezi Boutique Hotel, the double bed, appliances and natural materials, but also the coziness & enthusiasm of her youth. The separate toilet & shower spaces inside the room underline Luna’s rebellious nature.
neighborhood_overview: Ederlezi Boutique Hotel is located in 26 Lepeniotou Str. in Psirri, the artistic, vibrant & bohemian neighbourhood in the heart of Athens, below the shadow of the Acropolis. It is reached easily by the Athens Railway “Thissio” station or the central and iconic Monastiraki Metro station. The area around it, the Historic Center of Athens, is the literal heart of the city’s rich nightlife, while also being exceptionally close to all major landmarks of the Greek capital.
host_about:
I am Vasilis, but my friends call me Bill. I am an entrepreneur and escape room designer by profession and choice! I have studied Economics & Accounting in Greece. I have worked for years in Management and Human Resources in Greece’s most premium restaurant chain, constantly interacting with people and learning from them! During the last years I was part of the team that created Great Escape Rooms. Great Escape Rooms is one of the first and most successful Escape Room companies in Greece, based in Athens, but with branches in other cities in Greece and Cyprus. I love meeting new people and interacting with them!
My choice in movies and literature is classic, with murder mysteries and crime fiction being my absolute favourite! I also enjoy period pieces and my guilty pleasure is pirate movies and Greek classic films of past decades. I also love playing board games!

I have great knowledge of Athens, the places to visit, eat and drink. Athens is not just its famous ancient monuments, or the modern and stylish nightlife spots. It is the small, under-the-radar corners of a city that give it its flavour, and Athens has many of them.

name: Apartment Near Acropolis | Ederlezi Flora
description: Dedicated to her sisters yet versatile, Flora is the eldest. The most spacious suite of Ederlezi Boutique Hotel at 55 sq. m. in the 1st floor, it can accommodate 2-4 people, on a double bed & comfy sofa-turning-double bed. Flora has a lobby with a stone back wall and a separate living room with a uniquely styled and hand-crafted sofa made out of a single piece of chestnut wood, a true gift of Nature!

name: Acropolis Ederlezi Boutique Hotel | Olivia
description: Olivia never fitted in a mold. Always anti-conformist and different for the sake of difference itself, she did exactly the opposite of the others. The only room with 2 double bunk beds in its 27-sq. m., Olivia accommodates 2-4 people that can sleep, eat on the handmade chestnut table and discuss all night long, exploring themselves and life, while enjoying the amenities of Ederlezi Boutique Hotel and the vibes of Psyri.

name: Private room in flatshare (#4) *Kato Patissia*
description: Whether you are choosing Athens as an erasmus student, trainee or professional, this huge, centrally located flatshare may be the best affordable solution for accomodation. Bedrooms are on the back, overlooking the backyard from each balcony; in the front, there is a wide living room with marble flooring, decorated with a mix-and-match combination of antiques and modern furniture, as well as access to the big veranda. All rooms are fully equiped and furnished.
neighborhood_overview: Kato Patissia is a colourful, international neighborhood full of small shops and businesses, as well as medical centers and supermarkets. There is a street organic market twice a week where you can buy fruits, vegetables, fresh eggs and non brand clothes.
host_about: Greek, interested in science, sports and travelling!

neighborhood_overview: The building is located in the neighborhood of thiseio, one of the top destinations in Athens situated between Acropolis, Monastiraki and Kerameikos.The area of Thiseio worked as a mini industrial zone during 19th and late 20th century. Nowadays the area is featuring numerous restaurants and high quality cafes in listed old or industrial buildings

name: *At the foot of the Acropolis ~ Roof Deck ~ Views*
description:
Old Town Plaka, Athens, Greece
Private Room & Bathroom with Private Entrance - Acropolis View Roof Deck.

Experience the true Athens lifestyle by staying in the fully renovated, historic villa at the very foot of the Acropolis of Athens. The villa features unique fresco ceilings hand-painted in 1893 and is recognized by the Government for its exceptional cultural value. Its prime location provides quick access to restaurants, shops, and numerous historical landmarks.
neighborhood_overview:
This jewel of a property is located in the lively district of Plaka at the base and at the very foot of the Acropolis of Athens. It is situated on a famous pedestrian street, Thespidos, in the most striking and complete ancient Greek monumental complex still existing in our times. It offers fantastic views.

In addition to the famous landmark, you'll be surrounded by the old town shops, cafes, restaurants, and museums of the Acropolis. Known for its unique energy surrounding the Acropolis, one feels genuinely in a rare, magical area.

Here are some attractions you will surely be looking to visit.

✔ Acropolis of Athens
✔ Parthenon
✔ Acropolis Museum
✔ National Archaeological Museum
✔ Temple of Olympian Zeus
✔ Ancient Agora of Athens
✔ Panathenaic Stadium
✔ Odeon of Herodes Atticus
✔ Mount Lycabettus
host_about: My love for beautiful Greece and its culture made me return to Athens, where I have four fantastic Airbnb listings. There is nothing more reassuring and relaxing than finding a place that feels like a second home while traveling. In order to escape the tempo of everyday life, I enjoy painting, studying law, playing tennis, and eating delicious food. If you have any questions or even just want to say hello, please don't hesitate to contact

name: Nina's Athens Rooms: ANEMONE
description: The accommodation is located in Monastiraki only 2 min. away on foot from metro station "MONASTIRAKI"! In this stunning, historic area, in the heart of Athens! Attraction of the Athenians, tourists and more! The huge market, the attractions categorize the area in one of the most beautiful areas of Athens. A special area but also special!
neighborhood_overview:
In the heart of the Athenian center, Monastiraki is a unique blend of rhythms, seasons and cultures, vibrant and always dynamic – but firmly devoted to trade and the reunion of people. If we stand in the center of Monastiraki Square and make a 360-degree turn on the spot, we see in just a few square meters the history of Athens itself. Recently renovated, the square was paved with mosaic blocks of marble, stone and carved manteli, symbolizing the «flows» and the variety of colors of the Mediterranean peoples.
The Tzistarakis Mosque (1759) was named after the Ottoman Voevoda of Mustafa Aga Tzistarakis. It was also known as the Lower Fountain Mosque from the fountain nearby, which was supplied by Heridanos. Its use as a crafts museum begins after its first repair in 1915 and since 1975 it houses a remarkable collection of ceramics from Greece, Cyprus, Ottoman and modern Turkey. Inside there are information and photographs about the works and artists, but also the historical signific

All rooms are fully equiped and furnished.

name: Bedsit in the heart of Exarcheia
description: The room is located in the heart of the multicultural area of Exarcheia, the Shoreditch of Athens. The Acropolis, Monastiraki, Thiseio, Psyri, are just 20 minutes walk. You can jog or watch the sunset at Lycabetus, which is just 10 minutes away. Shops restaurants tavernas bars and bistros are just a stone's throw away. The National Archaeological Museum, The National Technical University and departments of the National and Kapodistrian University of Athens are just 5 to 10 minutes walk.

name: Your cozy room with shared bathroom and AC
description: The house is located in a very quiet neighbourhood where you can relax after a long day of sightseeing. As for decoration style we combined vintage with modern as we tried to preserve as much as possible from the house's character. The train stop is located within 3-5 minutes walking distance and it takes about 20 minutes by train to reach the city's center. So you are close enough to be easy reachable and in the same time far enough to be able to enjoy a quiet evening and a good night sleep.
neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood is very peaceful and quiet, there is a park near by, not as much pollution and noise as in the center. There are stores, supermarkets and coffee shops near by.
host_about:
I love traveling !!!
My job is about tourism also so I know exactly what you need for a successful vacation, my English is pretty good and I love to meet people from all over the world and make new friends.

Motto: "Give me a good reason and the possibilities are endless."

name: Theo Homeybee Exarcheia Apt No9-Room 1
description:
Hello Homey!

Cute and cosy 4th-floor private room in a two room apartment in Exarchia, one of the most prominent urban neighbourhoods in the heart of Athens. Being close to public transport stations (metro, bus, railway), yet in walking-distance from a variety of historic landmarks and must-see places in the city, it offers an ideal accommodation for individual travelers and loving couples as well.
neighborhood_overview:
A truly boheme neighbourhood in the heart of Athens.
Historic urban neighbourhood, one of the last authentic and unspoiled in Europe. Famous for its artistic essence and boheme aura, it is mostly inhabited and frequented by artists, musicians, writers, actors and creative minds. Low-paced daily routine, yet with plenty of nightlife choices, the neighbourhood will make you fall in love with the youthful urban lifestyle, from relaxing cafeterias and lively art spaces to alternative bars and picturesque restaurants. Pedion Areos Park and Lycabettus Hill are also great options for your morning walks, or even workouts - in case you’re the active type of person!
host_about:
Hello, I'm Theo.
  I live in the neighborhood of Exarcheia and I deal exclusively with the short-term rental of my privately owned apartments, so I have the opportunity to have discreet but direct contact with my guests and I will be very happy to help your smooth stay in Athens.
  I live very close to all my apartments and, as I am fully committed to the convenience and care of my guests' accommodation, I am always happy to meet new people and share local tips and "inside information" of the city.

  During the summer, I am also happy to have my guests at home for coffee or a drink - my house has a wonderful terrace with stunning views of Lycabettus, the Parthenon and the cityscape of Athens.  You'll love it!  In any other case, you will probably meet  coffee of the Exarcheion say hello and have a raki with me!

  We hope to see you soon!

name: Cosy Executive room in beautiful n quiet flat
description:
A large double room (with private lock) in a 2BR apartment on bright & breezy 4th floor in the Quiet and lovely side of Kato Patissia.

15mins metro/bus or 10 mins cab to Syntagma/Gazi/Monastriki; 30mins metro to beach, 50mins to airport.

This is a friendly neighbourhood of Greek + multi ethnic people. Just in 2 mins walk in any direction you can find Convenient shops, cafes and bars and small parks.

Lively high-streets of Achornon & Patission are full of cafes, restaurants & shops.
neighborhood_overview:
Quite and decent neighbourhood of Greek and mixed ethnicity families.

Petite Shops, bakeries, cafe, bars are 2 mins walk.

Supermarkets in 10mins walk - Lidl, AB, Mymarket, Marketin, Jumbo, and Skalenitis

Checkout 'greece-is dot com' and 'athens24 dot com' for local events
host_about:
I have been a globe trotter for 30 years. Now live between London and Athens, the two great cities standing tall over 2000 years.
I spend my spare Day times in Sailing, swimming and kayaking;  Night times - Latin n Afro dancing.
