name: A little Taste of Home Guest House 2
description: A little Taste of Home Guest House is an old stone house from the 30’s renovated with a charming traditional and contemporary styles mix. It features 4 large double rooms, in two different levels, with private bathrooms. Each level has a fully equipped shared kitchen leading out to a shaded terrace with plants, where you can enjoy your meals, work or relax. It is close to our restaurant 'A little Taste of Home' where we will meet you to take you to the Guesthouse.
host_about:
I was born in Palmyra Syria and living in Greece for the last 9 years.  I own the restaurant 'A little Taste of Home' which is all about guests feeling at home while savoring a favorite dish. We call it 'the home of taste travelers'. 

I have worked in the hospitality industry for more than 15 years. Hospitality is very important to my people and I like guests to feel at home when they stay at my apartment or eat at the restaurant. 

As a person I am easy going, an avid traveler and I love the sea and fishing.

name: Spacious Double room at Kypsli
description:
A beautiful cozy home with natural details such as wood, handmade objects and beautiful decorative corners
It’s artistic and eclectic,
the Kypseli neighborhood has a bit of everything. In addition to great eats, you’ll find shopping, theater, and culture, too. The Kypseli Municipal Market, once the neighborhood’s food market, is now a public space for local events and businesses. It’s quite modern, which contrasts with the old art.

name: Double room in 1960s flat
description: The room is in a spacious flat located on the 5th floor of a typical 60s apartment block in Kypseli, very near the city center. It has a double bed and a small wardrobe. The flat  consists of two bedrooms, a living room, a  kitchen, a bathroom and a balcony and at the moment we are two flatmates and a cat living here.
neighborhood_overview:
The house is located just behind the lovely Saint George square, full of children playing in the summer afternoons, and people eating and drinking in the evenings. Here you will find traditional greek cuisine, pastries and ice creams.
Kypseli is a lively district with excellent transport connection to the city center. It used to be an up-market area once (30s-60s) and among the 60s cement block apartment (alas, mine is one of them) you will still find some of the finest examples of athenian 20s-40s architecture, especially art deco and modernism.
Kypseli also offers numerous option to eat out, both with greek and ethnic cuisine, lots of cafes and cosy bars. (plus a legendery underground discoteque for winter)

name: Elegant Suite in the heart of Athens
description: This stylish Brand-new imposing accommodation facility in the heart of Athens, boasts fully renovated spacious suites with refined finishes combined with elegant touches providing the maximum comfort , space and light.
neighborhood_overview:
The Area

Iasonos Suites is located in the heart of Athens, at a prime location Iasonos 47 street , next to Metaxourgeio metro station. Metaxourgeio or Metaxourgio meaning "silk mill", is located north of the historical centre of Athens, between Kolonos to the east and Kerameikos to the west, and north of Gazi. For centuries, the area was largely rural and stood on the outskirts of the city. The construction of the Metaxourgeio factory in the early 19th century paved the way for the neighbourhood's inclusion in the larger urban area. During the course of Athens' dramatic growth in the late 19th century, Metaxourgeio became a thriving working-class neighbourhood, housing many craftsmen, tradesmen, and small-business owners. Continuing into the 1980s, the area's image of abandonment combined with a decrease in

name: Deluxe Apartment C1 by Elia Kolonaki
description: Inspired by the magnificent modernist dwellings of the area, these luxury studios and apartments in the poshest part of Athens blend top-tier design and premium comfort with sterling service.
neighborhood_overview: Elia Kolonaki Luxury Apartments is located some 100 meters away from Kolonaki Square – this historic neighbourhood’s beating heart. Take a stroll to discover Athens’ grandest neoclassical buildings – along with several high-end boutiques and stores, art galleries, museums, bustling bars and chic restaurants. Acropolis, Plaka and the historical centre are less than 20 mins on foot, whilst Syntagma Square is at 850 m. Lycabettus Hill, a verdant oasis in the midst of the city with captivating panoramic views, is no more than 15 minutes away on foot, and the gorgeous National Gardens just 400 metres.  Other nearby sights and attractions include the Benaki Museum, the Museum of Cycladic Art, and the University of Athens.
host_about: An innovator with a sterling 50-year track record in the fields of hospitality and tourism, Hellas Elements curates extraordinary experiences by capturing and translating the (quint) essence of Greece into unforgettable moments. From exceptional accommodations in iconic destinations on the islands and the mainland to bespoke concierge services, we enrich your stays with uniquely crafted elements to create memorable journeys.

name: Nina's Athens Rooms: NAFSIKA
description: The accommodation is located in Monastiraki just 2 min. walking distance from metro station "Monastiraki"! In this stunning, historic area, in the heart of Athens! Pole of attraction of Athenians, tourists and more! The huge market, the sights categorize the area in one of the most beautiful areas of Athens. An area that is special but also special!
neighborhood_overview:
In the heart of the Athenian center, Monastiraki is a unique blend of rhythms, seasons and cultures, vibrant and always dynamic – yet, steadily dedicated to trade and meeting people. If we stand in the center of Monastiraki Square and make a 360-degree turn on the spot, we see the history of Athens itself in just a few square meters. Recently renovated, the Square was paved with mosaic blocks of marble, stone and carved cast iron, symbolizing the "flows" and the diversity of colours of the peoples of the Mediterranean.
The Tzistarakis Mosque (1759) took its name from the Ottoman Voivodship of the city of Mustafa Aga Tzistarakis. It was also known as the Lower Fountain Mosque from the nearby fountain, which was fed by Eridanos. Its use as a museum of handicrafts begins after its first repair in 1915 and since 1975 it houses a remarkable collection of pottery from Greece, Cyprus, Ottoman and modern Turkey. name: Work or Vacation in shared apartment
description:
The area has all kinds of shops and cafes, bistros, restaurants, souvlaki, bars.

The apartment is 20 minutes walking to Acropolis,between alsos park and National garden which is next to parliament , Syntagma square ( center of Athens ). Half hour walking to Univercity campus .
45 minutes from airport by bus .
Pireus port in 20 minutes by metro .
Electric fan also available .
Central heating and electric air heating in every room .
neighborhood_overview:
In 2 blocks distance ( 120 m ) , there is bakery , super market , bucher and vegetables shops .
In the same distance is Plastira square where starts a lot of shops , cafe's , restaurants and music places .
At the other direction it leads to National park and center of Athens , Acropolis and the old town (Plaka ) .
At 2 blocks distance from the house there is Alsos Park .
host_about:

name: Junior Suite with Terrace  by 33 Solonos Suites
description: Our Luxury Suite  can comfortably accommodate 2-4 guests. It features wooden floors and high hand-painted wooden ceilings throughout, a queen-sized bed with Egyptian cotton coverings facing a beautifully made burgundy marble fireplace, as well as a sitting area. In a separate area, guests can enjoy their private dining area, fully equipped with a kitchenette, which overlooks the semi-private patio.
neighborhood_overview:
33 Solonos Suites is perfectly located in the heart of Athens, the affluent and upbeat Kolonaki, right between Syntagma Square and the Parliament Building, walking distance from a plethora of shops (both the high street and luxury boutiques).

The Suites are located:
8-minute walk from Syntagma square, where you can see the Greek Parliament, Tomb of the Unknown Soldier, and also find restaurants, bars, and retail shops. You can marvel at the beautiful buildings nearby, such as the University of Athens, the Neoclassical buildings and and many others.

15-minute walk from the bustling Monastiraki area, the famous Flea Market, key archeological sites (such as the Ancient Greek Agora, the remains of the Roman Agora, Hadrian’s Arch, among others). A few moments away is Plaka, Athens’ old town with its narrow-cobbled streets, for an al fresco lunch under the Greek sun.

20-minute walk from the Acropolis, to marvel at Greece’s iconic site and visit the Acrop
host_about:
We are Bill & John two young entrepreneurs with family ties. We were both born in Athens and continue living in this fascinating city. We have both spent our early years in the tourism and hospitality industry assisting our family in its hotel and tour operator ventures. Bill holds a bachelor in Hospitality Management & International Tourism and John holds a bachelor in Marketing & Communication. 
We are committed to greeting our guests with large measures of Hellenic Filoxenia! 
We both love traveling and discovering new cultures.

The NLH philosophy offers a new kind of product and service whilst traveling; one that is comfortable and simple, a place where you can seamlessly be connected, a place where design adds to the uniqueness of the adventure.

NLH Hotels have been designed for the modern traveler with high-quality services and seamless comfort that truly add value to the travel experience.

They operate as traveler’s hubs with personality, furnished with taste and superb functionality, creating a comfortable, homey and stylish hotel experience.

name: Single | Athens Hawks
description:
Welcome to Athens Hawks!!

This space is perfect for people looking to explore what Athens has to offer.

Athens Hawks offers a great atmosphere you’re sure to feel at home in. Featuring comfortable couches, welcoming bar, it’s easy to let the day’s worries melt away while you enjoy the world’s best beers or your favorite type of wine or even playing billiard.
host_about: Welcome to Athens Hawks Hostel! It’s modern, it’s clean and it’s the hub of backpacker activity, right in the heart of Athens. With a fresh layout, friendly staff and funky activities, Hawks Hostel aims to offer an experience, not just a bed. Situated exactly in the centre of Athens – only 15 min walk from Acropolis and all the main historical sites! Where can you stay? We can offer you high accommodation standard in newly renovated rooms with private bathrooms. Several rooms (especially on top floor) offer a magnificent view of Athens city center. For backpackers, we offer spacious dorms with their own lockers, drawers with lamps either female or mixed.

name: Theo Homeybee Exarcheia Apt No12-Room 2
description:
Hello Homey!

Cute and cosy 4th-floor private room in 5 rooms apartment in Exarchia, one of the most prominent urban neighbourhoods in the heart of Athens. Being close to public transport stations (metro, bus, railway), yet in walking-distance from a variety of historic landmarks and must-see places in the city, it offers an ideal accommodation for individual travelers and loving couples as well.
neighborhood_overview:
A truly boheme neighbourhood in the heart of Athens.
Historic urban neighbourhood, one of the last authentic and unspoiled in Europe. Famous for its artistic essence and boheme aura, it is mostly inhabited and frequented by artists, musicians, writers, actors and creative minds. Low-paced daily routine, yet with plenty of nightlife choices, the neighbourhood will make you fall in love with the youthful urban lifestyle, from relaxing cafeterias and lively art spaces to alternative bars and picturesque restaurants. Pedion Areos Park are also great options for your morning walks, or even workouts - in case you’re the active type of person!
host_about:
Hello, I'm Theo.
  I live in the neighborhood of Exarcheia and I deal exclusively with the short-term rental of my privately owned apartments, so I have the opportunity to have discreet but direct contact with my guests and I will be very happy to help your smooth stay in Athens.
  I live very close to all my apartments and, as I am fully committed to the convenience and care of my guests' accommodation, I am always happy to meet new people and share local tips and "inside information" of the city.

  During the summer, I am also happy to have my guests at home for coffee or a drink - my house has a wonderful terrace with stunning views of Lycabettus, the Parthenon and the cityscape of Athens.  You'll love it!  In any other case, you will probably meet  coffee of the Exarcheion say hello and have a raki with me!

  We hope to see you soon!

name: Family Room at Trendy Hotel by Athens Prime Hotels
description: The Trendy by Athens Prime Hotels Family Room with a maximum occupancy of 6 people, is complete with a classy modern design and a spacious private bathroom. This room category is ideal especially for families since it is spacious, located on the lowest floor of the Trendy Hotel, in the heart of Athens. The room is approximately 26-39 sq. meters and offers all the basic amenities such as one sofa, a mini-refrigerator, an electronic safe box, etc. Its' comfort will make your stay unforgettable!
neighborhood_overview: The Trendy by Athens Prime Hotels is situated in the heart of Athens. Ideal accommodation especially for business travelers as well as for leisure travelers due to its central location and close proximity to the many means of transportation, such as the metro, as well as most points of interest such as museums and major archeological sites of Athens (Acropolis, Ancient Agora, etc.). Bars, restaurants, shops, and supermarkets are all within walking distance, making it convenient for the hotels' guests to access them.

name: Private Bright Room in Center of Athens
description: Comfortable room with queen sized bed in the center of Athens. Private room/Shared apartment. Fully equipped. Syntagma Square (2km), Acropolis (2.5 km), Airport (17 km) and Piraeus Port (11 km). Blue metro line (Megaro Mousikis) 350 meters away, making it easy to visit all major attractions. 20 minute walk to Syntagma & AB supermarket 900 meters away. host_about: I love meeting new people and hosting guests from around the globe. Travel, culture, music, and enjoying life are my passion. Good Vibes. name: Superior Queen Room by 33 Solonos suites
description: The lavish Luxury Suite  can comfortably accommodate 2-4 guests. It features wooden floors and high hand-painted wooden ceilings throughout, a queen-sized bed with Egyptian cotton coverings facing a beautifully made burgundy marble fireplace, as well as a sitting area. In a separate area, guests can enjoy their private dining area, fully equipped with a kitchenette, which overlooks the semi-private patio.
neighborhood_overview:
33 Solonos Suites is perfectly located in the heart of Athens, the affluent and upbeat Kolonaki, right between Syntagma Square and the Parliament Building, walking distance from a plethora of shops (both the high street and luxury boutiques).

The Suites are located:
8-minute walk from Syntagma square, where you can see the Greek Parliament, Tomb of the Unknown Soldier, and also find restaurants, bars, and retail shops. You can marvel at the beautiful buildings nearby, such as the University of Athens, the Neoclassical buildings and and many others.

15-minute walk from the bustling Monastiraki area, the famous Flea Market, key archeological sites (such as the Ancient Greek Agora, the remains of the Roman Agora, Hadrian’s Arch, among others). A few moments away is Plaka, Athens’ old town with its narrow-cobbled streets, for an al fresco lunch under the Greek sun.

20-minute walk from the Acropolis, to marvel at Greece’s iconic site and visit the Acrop
host_about:
We are Bill & John two young entrepreneurs with family ties. We were both born in Athens and continue living in this fascinating city. We have both spent our early years in the tourism and hospitality industry assisting our family in its hotel and tour operator ventures. Bill holds a bachelor in Hospitality Management & International Tourism and John holds a bachelor in Marketing & Communication. 
We are committed to greeting our guests with large measures of Hellenic Filoxenia! 
We both love traveling and discovering new cultures.

name: Double with Acropolis View | Pella Inn
description:
The only Hostel in Athens, where antiquity, modernity, comfort and value all meets in the best location in the city of Athens with the best view of the Acropolis. The rooftop has a direct view of the Acropolis and is perfect for chilling out, having a good time and meeting other travelers.

Room with view at Acropolis!

Only 10 minutes to Acropolis on foot!
Only 5 minutes to Monastiraki metro station on foot!

Free Internet,
Reception Is Open 24/24 (No Curfew),
Lockers etc
host_about: Pella Inn is situated in the heart of the old town of Athens within walking distance from the famous Acropolis, Monastiraki square and Plaka. The rooms and their balconies have a direct view of the Acropolis, as does the rooftop bar, which is perfect for chilling out, having a good time and meeting other travelers while enjoying the amazing view of the Acropolis and the rest of the city. The nearest metro station, Monastiraki, is only 150 meters away providing easy access to and from the airport, as well as a direct line to the port of Piraeus. The excellent location of Pella Inn gives you immediate access to all the interesting sights of Athens such as the Acropolis, the Ancient Agora, Keramikos, the Olympic Stadium, the National Archaeological Museum, etc. Our friendly staff is always prepared to advise you on how to get around the city, from the tourist sites to places 'off the beaten path'.

name: Deluxe Double Room C2 by Elia Kolonaki
description: Inspired by the magnificent modernist dwellings of the area, these luxury studios and apartments in the poshest part of Athens blend top-tier design and premium comfort with sterling service.
neighborhood_overview: Elia Kolonaki Luxury Apartments is located some 100 meters away from Kolonaki Square – this historic neighbourhood’s beating heart. Take a stroll to discover Athens’ grandest neoclassical buildings – along with several high-end boutiques and stores, art galleries, museums, bustling bars and chic restaurants. Acropolis, Plaka and the historical centre are less than 20 mins on foot, whilst Syntagma Square is at 850 m. Lycabettus Hill, a verdant oasis in the midst of the city with captivating panoramic views, is no more than 15 minutes away on foot, and the gorgeous National Gardens just 400 metres.  Other nearby sights and attractions include the Benaki Museum, the Museum of Cycladic Art, and the University of Athens.
host_about: An innovator with a sterling 50-year track record in the fields of hospitality and tourism, Hellas Elements curates extraordinary experiences by capturing and translating the (quint) essence of Greece into unforgettable moments. From exceptional accommodations in iconic destinations on the islands and the mainland to bespoke concierge services, we enrich your stays with uniquely crafted elements to create memorable journeys.

name: Standard Double Room C4 by Elia Kolonaki
description: Inspired by the magnificent modernist dwellings of the area, these luxury studios and apartments in the poshest part of Athens blend top-tier design and premium comfort with sterling service.
neighborhood_overview: Elia Kolonaki Luxury Apartments is located some 100 meters away from Kolonaki Square – this historic neighbourhood’s beating heart. Take a stroll to discover Athens’ grandest neoclassical buildings – along with several high-end boutiques and stores, art galleries, museums, bustling bars and chic restaurants. Acropolis, Plaka and the historical centre are less than 20 mins on foot, whilst Syntagma Square is at 850 m. Lycabettus Hill, a verdant oasis in the midst of the city with captivating panoramic views, is no more than 15 minutes away on foot, and the gorgeous National Gardens just 400 metres.  Other nearby sights and attractions include the Benaki Museum, the Museum of Cycladic Art, and the University of Athens.
host_about: An innovator with a sterling 50-year track record in the fields of hospitality and tourism, Hellas Elements curates extraordinary experiences by capturing and translating the (quint) essence of Greece into unforgettable moments. From exceptional accommodations in iconic destinations on the islands and the mainland to bespoke concierge services, we enrich your stays with uniquely crafted elements to create memorable journeys.

name: Single room in Athens Starlight Hotel
description:
In the heart of Athens, the much beloved and most gorgeous neighborhood of Athens, Monastiraki Area, in the lively Athens Commercial Triangle, a hospitality star is born, the Athens Starlight Hotel. There is no much to say about the location of the Athens Starlight Hotel, it is right in the middle of an area that is brimming with shops, hipster restaurants, traditional taverns, and trendy bars, within distance to most major sights of the city.

You can select your room type among 8 type of rooms
host_about:
In the heart of Athens, the much beloved and most gorgeous neighbourhood of Athens, Monastiraki area, in the lively Athens Commercial Triangle, a hospitality star is born, the Athens Starlight Hotel. There is not much to say about the location of the Athens Starlight Hotel, it is right in the middle of an area that is brimming with shops, hipster restaurants, traditional taverns, and trendy bars, within walking distance to most major sights of the city.

The repurposed old commercial building, that houses Athens Starlight Hotel, is located in Agathonos street, and was carefully renovated and elegantly refurbished to become a hospitality star.

Offering a wide selection of room types, services, and amenities that will meet the needs of our guests and ensure a pleasant stay in Athens, the brand-new Athens Starlight Hotel opened its doors in July 2019.

You can select your room or suite among 8 types of stylish decorated spaces that can accommodate comfortably up to 4 guests, enjoy your breakfast in the gorgeous Athens Starlight Hotel Breakfast Room, and hold a professional meeting in the Athens Starlight Hotel Meeting Room. The hotel front desk staff is at your disposal to help you make the most of your stay in Athens, book tours, excursions and tickets, recommend restaurants and bars, or call a taxi.

We will be delighted to see you soon at the Athens Starlight Hotel!

The Ancient Agora of Athens and the Technopolis in Gazi are 2.1 km away. from Diamond Apartment. Near the area you will also find a supermarket (Skalavenitis) at 700 meters, and Fournos (Bread factory).

The choice of accommodation is suitable for guests who want to travel by public transport Diamond Apartment is located 300 meters from the metro (Metaxourgio
host_about: Diamond Apartment has 1 fully equipped apartment in the heart of Athens. A brand new modern apartment promises to offer a comfortable and luxurious stay. A real "home away from home" whether you are traveling for business or leisure. Our goal is to provide excellent and comfortable accommodation according to the needs and desires of our guests. .Diamond Apartments are located in the historic district of Metaxourgio, close to the most famous sights of Athens and close to Metaxourgio metro station. Athens International Airport "Eleftherios Venizelos", the port of Piraeus and the train station of Athens are easily accessible by public transport or by taxi.

name: athensvintage_1
description: Stay in the center of the action in this one-of-a-kind place.
neighborhood_overview:
Athens, the capital of Greece, is a city with ancient history and rich culture. It is known for its archaeological treasures, stunning architecture, and vibrancy.

Next to your home, you can visit sights like the Stoa of Attalos, an ancient shopping mall that has been rebuilt and now serves as a museum. You can also visit Little Kook, a shop with distinctive decor and sweets to enjoy.

For music lovers, the Museum of Greek Folk Musical Instruments "Phivos Anogianakis" - Center for Ethnomusicology is worth a visit. There you can see a collection of traditional musical instruments and learn about the Greek musical tradition.

Also do not forget to visit the Ancient Agora of Athens, an archaeological site with important monuments such as the Temple of Apollo Patras, the Temple of Ephesus and the Stoa of Attalos.

Finally, you can visit the Museum of the City of Athens – Vourou-Eftaxia Foundation, where you can explore the history of the city through

name: Penthouse Hot Tub Athens
description:
In the heart of Athens, the much beloved and most gorgeous neighborhood of Athens, Monastiraki Area, in the lively Athens Commercial Triangle, a hospitality star is born, the Athens Starlight Hotel. There is no much to say about the location of the Athens Starlight Hotel, it is right in the middle of an area that is brimming with shops, hipster restaurants, traditional taverns, and trendy bars, within distance to most major sights of the city.

You can select your room type among 8 type of rooms
host_about:
In the heart of Athens, the much beloved and most gorgeous neighbourhood of Athens, Monastiraki area, in the lively Athens Commercial Triangle, a hospitality star is born, the Athens Starlight Hotel. There is not much to say about the location of the Athens Starlight Hotel, it is right in the middle of an area that is brimming with shops, hipster restaurants, traditional taverns, and trendy bars, within walking distance to most major sights of the city.

The repurposed old commercial building, that houses Athens Starlight Hotel, is located in Agathonos street, and was carefully renovated and elegantly refurbished to become a hospitality star.

Offering a wide selection of room types, services, and amenities that will meet the needs of our guests and ensure a pleasant stay in Athens, the brand-new Athens Starlight Hotel opened its doors in July 2019.

You can select your room or suite among 8 types of stylish decorated spaces that can accommodate comfortably up to 4 guests, enjoy your breakfast in the gorgeous Athens Starlight Hotel Breakfast Room, and hold a professional meeting in the Athens Starlight Hotel Meeting Room. The hotel front desk staff is at your disposal to help you make the most of your stay in Athens, book tours, excursions and tickets, recommend restaurants and bars, or call a taxi.

We will be delighted to see you soon at the Athens Starlight Hotel!

name: Acropolis View Residence overlooking the Parthenon
description:
The Acropolis View Residence is a luxurious and stylish one-bedroom Penthouse rental, situated in the heart of the most elegant residential block of Athens at the doorstep of the Acropolis Museum.
Blending antique and contemporary design, the residence features a grand living room overlooking the Parthenon, the Museum and the Philopappou Hill. Large French doors open to a 360 degree balcony with panoramic view, where you can sunbathe or dine al fresco.
neighborhood_overview:
You'll love the location, just around the corner from the Acropolis entrance and the renowned Acropolis Museum. Stroll to nearby Plaka old district where you can explore, walk, jog or lunch overlooking the” sacred rock”. A stone’s throw from all the main historic monuments of the Classical and Roman times as  well as the new Contemporary Museum of Art.

Or take a brisk walk to Athens’s shopping hotspots at Constitution square (20 min), Ermou and  Voukourestiou streets. With the Acropolis Metro station just around the corner, it’s easy to reach all the vibrant neighborhoods across Athens during your stay.

The property is managed by the adjacent 4 star Herodion hotel, where the Front Desk is always at your service, available 24 hours a day. As a Residence guest, you will check at the Herodion Ηotel where a daily pass with access to all hotel services will be provided. name: Private room in Pangrati apartment (Room A_404)
description:
If you are looking for a place to stay long-term or short-term, I am sure the room will fit your needs.
The apartment is in a key location, close to the center but also far enough to avoid noise. It's a 15 minutes walk away from the Syntagma metro station and a 10 minutes walk from Euagelismos metro station. There are a lot of green spaces close to the apartment, like a park which is next to it, the hill of Kalimarmaro Stadium and also the National Garden.
neighborhood_overview: Pangrati is a balanced neighborhood with both a calm and easygoing day-life and a vibing night-life. I am pretty sure you will find everything you are looking for in a 10 minute distance from the apartment. The neighborhood has a lot of greens spaces and the apartment is located next to a park.
host_about:
Hello!
My name is Orfeas Voutsinos-Frantzis.
I am a PhD student at the Agricultural University of Athens. I study the plant "cichorium spinosum" in different agricultural systems, from organic open field to vertical farms. I also am the co-founder of the Dutch-based startup "Farmvent" (Website hidden by Airbnb)  that focuses on vertical farming solutions.

I will be staying in the same apartment as you will.
There are 3 bedrooms in the apartment and I stay in one of them. You might meet another airbnb guest staying at the other room at the time of your stay.

I honestly enjoy meeting you guys. It's like doing erasmus from home in a way. I met a lot of interesting people throughout the years I've been doing airbnb and I became good friends with some of you. I apologize in advance  in case we meet in period where I am undergoing a lot of work-related pressure and I am not that socially active. I do enjoy when people enjoy the environment of the apartment.

I look forward to meeting you

name: Ceramian 2.3
description: This cozy suite is ideal for 2 people. Featuring a Cocomat queen size bed, a spacious bathroom with walk in shower and floor-to-ceiling opening to a beautiful balcony with Acropolis views, this suite will become your perfect base to explore Athens
neighborhood_overview: The room is located in the heart of Kerameikos, an area overflowing with history. Kerameikos took its name from the word kéramos ("pottery clay", from which the English word "ceramic" is derived), because of the many ceramists who lived and worked there in ancient times.  In this sacred area between the Parthenon and Dēmósion Sēma, our guests are bound to submerge themselves in the lavish ancient Greek history.  But Kerameikos of nowadays has much more to offer. Some of Athens most exquisite restaurants are located steps away. Bars, caffes, museums, art galleries, local markets set the scene of a vibrant, lively, edgy and interesting place to live.  Combining the allure of an unspoiled, old-fashioned, original neighborhood with its central location, our apartment makes the perfect starting point to discover and experience Athens
host_about: Enthusiastic traveler, positive thinker, fashion lover, style creator, daytime dreamer, chocolate aficionado, ice cream addicted. Live by my motto: Dream, Love, Laugh, TRAVEL !!

name: Relaxing room with shared bathroom and AC
description:
Enjoy a private room in a quiet and relaxing area of Athens! Our property comes with a shared kitchen and dining room where you are more than welcome to prepare your meals. We also have a small backyard full with plants and flowers where you can, eat, chill or lay on a hammock.
There are bars, restaurants, supermarkets, pharmacies close to the property, the train stop is within 4 minutes walking distance.
In less than 20 minutes you can be in the city's center. Easy acces to port and airport!

I love traveling !!!
My job is about tourism also so I know exactly what you need for a successful vacation, my English is pretty good and I love to meet people from all over the world and make new friends.

Welcome to Olenou 6-8, nestled in the beating heart of Polygono. This isn't just an apartment; it's your gateway to the authentic Athenian experience. Our cozy haven on the 2nd floor invites you into the soul of the city, where history meets modernity, and every corner tells a story.


• Polygono Magic: Step outside, and you're in the midst of Polygono's vibrant tapestry. Explore charming alleyways, adorned with street art and the aroma of local delicacies wafting from neighborhood tavernas.

• Your Private Balcony: Your room comes with its own private balcony – a slice of Athenian heaven just for you. Sip your morning Greek coffee as the city awakens or savor an evening breeze under a star-lit sky. It's your personal retreat above the lively streets.

neighborhood_overview:
Situated just a 10 min walk away from the Suggrou Fix Metro Station, Koukaki offers seamless connectivity to other parts of the city, allowing residents and visitors to easily explore the rich history and modern marvels that Athens has to offer. The area's well-lit streets and friendly locals contribute to its reputation as a safe haven within the bustling metropolis.

Koukaki is undeniably one of the best areas in Athens, offering a harmonious blend of ancient and modern attractions. The neighborhood is dotted with an assortment of traditional Greek tavernas, trendy cafes, and eclectic shops that cater to a variety of tastes and preferences. Its charming, tree-lined streets and well-maintained parks provide a serene backdrop for leisurely strolls or picnics, making it an appealing choice for families and individuals seeking a peaceful yet stimulating living experience in Athens.

In summary, Koukaki's safe environment, close proximity to historic landmarks and muse

name: Derigny The Mansion #B5
description:
Welcome to Derigny Mansion .
Fully renovated & furbished, elegant, bright and spacious building of 1910 with high standards, ideal for pleasant stay, particularly on mid-long range.
Just 5min walk from National Archeological museum ,Victoria Metro station and national Park.
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is a friendly multicultural area.
Every Wednesday you can walk by the local street market. You can find there fruits and vegetables in excellent condition and very cheap prices.
In the near vicinity you can find supermarket,bakery ,pharmacy, police station etc.
The building at 16 Derigny Street is easily accessible as it is 120m away from the Athens University of Economics and Business, 350m from Victoria Metro Station, 200m from the Areos Park, 700m from the National Archaeological Museum, 950m from the National Technical University of Athens and 1400m away from the Omonia Square.
host_about:
"The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step." - Lao Tzu 

Hello,
My name is Téo. I am passionate traveller who loves to discover new cultures as well as sharing experiences and meet new people from all over the world. 
My aim on Airbnb is to give to my guests the best Greek hospitality ever. 
Me and my team will be next to you for everything you need.

name: Neapolis 1897 Boutique Hotel Phryne Room
description: Neapolis 1897 Boutique Hotel was originally built in 1897 as prestigious mansion with a neoclassical design. In 2022 the full restoration was complete in order to preserve the original form of the building and to re-establish itself as a unique boutique hotel in the centre of Athens. Neapolis 1897 will offer you an immaculate experience and will travel you back in time.
neighborhood_overview:
Exarcheia neighborhood in Athens is nestled between the foot of the beautiful Lycabettus Hill and Pedion tou Areos, one of the largest parks in Athens. It borders with the classy neighborhood of Kolonaki and Omonia square on the south and it’s only a few minutes away from Syntagma and the Academy of Athens.

Exarcheia has an edgy alternative vibe ,its streets decorated with politically charged murals and lined with bookshops. Bars and Clubs host live music , including jazz and punk acts.

name: Α&Ν Αthens LuxuryApartments-Akadimou,Executive 301
description: The suite is completely renovated with an emphasis on detail and comfort, so you can feel like home. It combines unique design, comfort and is fully equipped with various amenities such as free wi-fi, air conditioning, wooden flooring, kitchen, balcony, shower, 50-inch TV and free a bottle of wine!
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located at a quiet street where you will be able to feel like permanent residents of the area. Within walking distance is Avdi square, Metaxourgeio, which is surrounded by well-known restaurants, theaters, quirky buildings and all day bars. In 2008 the square was completely remodeled, with green spaces, benches, trees, and recreational areas. Now the square is a meeting point for many community activities and activities making it one of the most vibrant squares in Athens.

name: Room in the house of colors
description: Welcome to my place! You'll stay in one of two bedrooms, which is equipped with a queen size bed, a desk, a large cupboard, an a/c, and fast wi-fi. The bathroom, kitchen, and all other spaces will be shared with me. I am a ceramicist, painter, art historian and plant lover. I've been renovating my apartment recently, trying to make each corner unique. The place is still a work in progress, but perfectly livable. It is quiet, comfy, colorful, green, and has a large terrace to chill out!
neighborhood_overview: Gkyzi, where my place is located, is a quiet and safe residential neighborhood. My apartment is one minute away from Gkyzi's main square and around the corner from a street lined with a variety of stores: pharmacies, grocery stores (including one open 7 days a week), copy shops, clothing stores, cafés, etc. There isn't a large variety of bars and restaurants in this area, but if you walk for 10-15 minutes you will be in Exarcheia, which is full of them. If you like nature, there's a big park 5-minutes from my place (the Pedion of Areos), and within a 15-minute walk you can reach the Lycabettus hill, which offers unbeatable views of Athens. Amazing art is also quite near, as you can easily walk through the Pedion of Areos up to the National Archaeological Museum.
host_about: Hi! I am an art historian and I divide my time between teaching and making art. I love traveling, reading, cooking, and good food. And I like meeting people from different places and backgrounds, cause it's always enriching!

name: Theo Homeybee Victoria Apt No13-Room 1
description:
Hello Homey!

Cute and comfortable 1st floor private room in a five room apartment, next to Victoria Square, in the center of Athens and only 5 minutes away from Agios Georgios Square, a popular hang out spot. neighborhood_overview:
Charming and colorful neighborhood in the heart of Athens. Patision Street is one of the streets that were laid out in such a way that as you move towards the historical center you always have the Parthenon in your field of vision! It is the road where all public transport runs to and from the historic center with many shops! Directly opposite Patision Street begins the neighborhood of Kypseli.
"Kypseli" in Greek means beehive and the reasons for its name can easily be justified through a short walk through its colorful and charming streets, inhabited by people from countries and nationalities from all over the world. Multicultural and bohemian in its own special way, Kypseli is a wonderful area to explore, with a variety of cafes, restaurants and cultural meeting points. The financial University is very close for students, the Pedion Areos Park near the apartment and the pedestrian street of Fokionos Negri are also great options for your morning walks or even workouts - in ca

name: Theo Homeybee Omonia Victoria Apt No14-Room 1
description:
Welcome Homey!

Cute and cosy 2nd-floor private room in a 4 room apartment in Exarchia, one of the most prominent urban neighbourhoods in the heart of Athens. Being close to public transport stations (metro, bus, railway), yet in walking-distance from a variety of historic landmarks and must-see places in the city, it offers an ideal accommodation for individual travelers.
neighborhood_overview:
The Neighbourhood: A truly boheme neighborhood in the heart of Athens.
Historic urban neighborhood, one of the last authentic and unspoiled in Europe. Famous for its artistic essence and boheme aura, it is mostly inhabited and frequented by artists, musicians, writers, actors and creative minds. Low-paced daily routine, yet with plenty of nightlife choices, the neighborhood will make you fall in love with the youthful urban lifestyle, from relaxing cafeterias and lively art spaces to alternative bars and picturesque restaurants. Pedion Areos Park and Lycabettus Hill are also great options for your morning walks or workouts - in case you’re the active type of person!
host_about:
Hello, I'm Theo.
  I live in the neighborhood of Exarcheia and I deal exclusively with the short-term rental of my privately owned apartments, so I have the opportunity to have discreet but direct contact with my guests and I will be very happy to help your smooth stay in Athens.
  I live very close to all my apartments and, as I am fully committed to the convenience and care of my guests' accommodation, I am always happy to meet new people and share local tips and "inside information" of the city.

  During the summer, I am also happy to have my guests at home for coffee or a drink - my house has a wonderful terrace with stunning views of Lycabettus, the Parthenon and the cityscape of Athens.  You'll love it!  In any other case, you will probably meet  coffee of the Exarcheion say hello and have a raki with me!

  We hope to see you soon!

name: Colorful and Quiet Room w/Balcony next to Hilton
description:
Our flat is in the Ilisia district of Athens, 5 minutes away from the Megaro Moussikis metro station. Syntagma Square, where the Greek Parliament is located, could be reached by 20min walk via the wide Leof Vasilissis Street surrounded by many notable museums.

Ilisia is one of the decent districts of Athens and it is quite and safe, also offering multiple dining options, if you don't feel like going further away.

We offer two guestrooms in our home and try to help our guest to enjoy Athens.
neighborhood_overview:
Ilisia, one of the most decent districts in Athens, is within walking distance of the main attractions, museums, Athens Concert Hall and the cosmopolitan Kolonaki district.

It also offers variety of cafes and dining options.
host_about:
Hi,

I am Kumsal,

I am a frequent traveller and an architecture student.

I have been hosting travellers on Airbnb with my family since 2019 in Istanbul and just started to offer two lovely rooms in central Athens in the apartment, where I am living with my husband and our two cats.

We are looking forward to greet our guests and hope we will be helpful for them to get the taste of Athens.

Exarchia houses some of the best university schools in Athens, the Kapodistrian University and the National Technical University of Athens. Lots of young and students choose Exarchia shops for their fun, which adds another touch to the area.

Access to Exarcheia is very easy since it is only a few minutes away from the most central metro and bus stations of Athens. By taking the metro, buses or walking, you can visit historical points of interest such as the National Archaeological Museum, the Archaeological site of the Acropolis, the Acropolis museum, the National Garden and the Panathenaic Stadium.

name: Minimal room in spaceous condo
description: Enjoy a stylish experience at this centrally-located place.
neighborhood_overview:
The house is located on the borders of Plato's Academy and Metaxourgeio.

The Plato's Academy area, located in the northeastern part of Athens, Greece, is steeped in history and culture. The site is most well-known for being the location of the Academy, a school of philosophy founded by the ancient Greek philosopher Plato in 387 BCE. The Academy was one of the earliest institutions of higher learning in the Western world and was an important center of learning and scholarship for over 900 years.

The Plato's Academy area is easily accessible by public transportation, with several bus and metro stops nearby providing easy access to other parts of the city.

Metaxourgeio, on the other side, is a vibrant and eclectic neighborhood located in the heart of Athens, Greece. Known for its bohemian vibe and artistic atmosphere, the area has become a popular destination for locals and tourists alike.

name: Beautiful Home Downtown, under Lycabettus Hill
description:
Experience the city like a local living in the vibrant bohemian neighborhood of Exarcheia at the heart of the city: The Acropolis is just a quick 20' ride away by public transport, as well as every museum, café, restaurant, park and stroll worth visiting!

You'll stay in a traditional 70s athenian home bought by my grandparents, now redecorated while preserving its authentic charm. I live here with my cat Persa, so it's fully equipped and you can enjoy its benefits with love and care :)
neighborhood_overview:
What about Exarcheia? Vibrant streets adorned with street art and political murals. Neoclassical buildings in charming streets. A blend of cultures and cuisines, Greek flavors and diverse eateries. Immerse yourself in arts and music scenes, engaging in open discourse with locals. Enjoy the electric nightlife of bars and cafes or find peaceful retreats amidst hidden green oases :)

Also, the house offers the convenience of proximity (2' walk away) to two large supermarkets and a variety of shops, pharmacies, and bus stops heading in three different directions, so you can explore every corner of the city with ease, making the most out of your Athens adventure!

name: WineSpa#3 private room by Oinapothiki Wine Taverna
description: WineSpa#3 is the biggest private room of our huge & bright apartment of 135 sqm in the 1st floor of our building. in a safe & quiet neighborhood in Athens Historical center next to Kallimarmaro Stadium, with air conditioning, working table, sofa bed & private veranda! You will have access to the Kitchen & dining room, seating room, 2xWC's & 3xshowers & veranda that are shared with other 5 guests. WineSpa#3 has its own e-lock to self check-in anytime you arrive home, with codes and e-key - Enjoy!
neighborhood_overview: A safe & lively neighborhood in Athens Historical center next to Kallimarmaro Stadium, National Park, Temple of Zeus, museums, churches and squares, where the President of the Democracy, the Mayor of Athens and the Prime Minister of Greece are also staying in 250 meters range. In 1 min by feet u can find restaurants, coffee shops, bars, mini markets, butcher, vegetables shop, museums, stadiums, temples, squares. Public transportation is passing by in 8 min by feet the max. Our place is located in a conjunction of sideroads, where no cars are passing under a plane forest that don't remind the center of a city!
host_about: I like fishing, diving and building stone houses with natural materials in my favourite island ikaria,  if I am not in our family's 1 century restaurant in the center of Athens - Enjoy your Game!

name: Psiri Vibes- Studio apartment
description: The Standard Studios are decorated in an artful, urban style. The 18 square meter, air-conditioned spaces feature a range of modern comforts, a queen-sized bed. All have large windows let abundant sunlight flow into the unit. The studios are fully soundproofed and have reinforced security front doors. They all feature beautiful graffiti art reflective of Psiri’s notable street art. All have access to the common kitchen area.
neighborhood_overview:
Psiri isn’t just a neighborhood; it's where Athens pulses with life, creativity, and the kind of energy you can’t find anywhere else. Right at the core of it all is Iroon Square, a place buzzing with the vibe of locals and travelers alike. Imagine streets brimming with bars where the music and laughter spill out into the night, coffee shops where the aroma of freshly brewed coffee invites you in for a moment of relaxation, and stores that range from artisanal treasures to the coolest hip finds.

And when the sun sets? Psiri just turns up the volume. Bars with live DJs, tavernas dishing out mouth-watering meatballs, Greek salads, and more traditional delights keep the night young and your adventures exciting. This is where Athenians themselves love to hang out, shop, and let loose. So, if you wanna see Athens through the eyes of those who know it best, Psiri’s your spot.
host_about: Hi, I am Yiannis . Our well-trained staff are happiness experts as they strive to make our guests’ stay enjoyable, seamless and memorable.

name: N Kato Patisia Room in a shared apartment
description: The 82 square meter 4-bedroom apartment located in the Kato Patisia area of North Athens offers double rooms with balconies, cupboards, and comfortable double beds. The shared facilities include a bathroom and kitchen. The apartment maintains its original 1960s style bathroom and features marble and wooden flooring. Situated on a busy street, the apartment overlooks a community park that serves as a popular gathering spot, resulting in occasional noise levels from outdoor activities
neighborhood_overview:
Kato Patisia is the southern, lower part of Patisia. It is a served by the Kato Patisia station of the Athens metro.

The Church of Agios Andreas (Patisia) is a notable historical structure. A church from the early Christian era in Athens, it was re-established as the katholikon of a monastery established by Saint Philothei in the late 16th century. St. Filothei was known for purchasing the freedom of women who had been forced into the harem during the Ottoman occupation. She was eventually imprisoned for this activity. This monastic church was the site where Ottoman mercenaries beat St. Filothei Ottoman during the evening church vigil service and beat her severely. She remained bedridden and died of her injuries on 19 February 1589.
host_about: Hi my name is Rusanda and I am an artist, I live in a country side most of the year. I like to rent my apartment to foreign visitors and hope that they will enjoy their stay in my small and beautiful country.

name: Triple Room By Acropolis Select
description: The hotel’s rooms are furnished with individual care and attention, all tastefully decorated and designed to cater to your comfort. The elegant interior is accented with warm, earthly tones which create a welcoming and relaxing atmosphere. Bathrooms are affixed with bathtubs and soothing showerheads while complimentary toiletries are provided. Acropolis Select Hotel provides you an American buffet breakfwith ast every morning.
neighborhood_overview:
Athens is one of the world’s oldest cities, as its recorded history spans around 3,400 years. According to Greek mythology, the city was given its name as a result of a competition between the Olympian gods, Poseidon and Athena, about who will become protector of the city. The myth goes that Poseidon provided a well with sea water whilst Athena offered an olive tree, a symbol of peace and prosperity, as she touched the ground of the sacred rock of the Acropolis. The people of Athens chose Athena as their protector and so the city was named after her. The two gods represent the strength of Athens as a city of wisdom and as a sea power.

The Acropolis Select Hotel is located in the Athenian suburb of Koukaki, one of the adjoining neighborhoods that borders the southern section of the Acropolis,Philopappos Hill and the historical district of Plaka. This area is occupied by beautiful neoclassical buildings along its narrow streets and the pedestrianized Dionysiou Areopagitou Aven
host_about:
We are Bill & John two young entrepreneurs with family ties. We were both born in Athens and continue living in this fascinating city. We have both spent our early years in the tourism and hospitality industry assisting our family in its hotel and tour operator ventures. Bill holds a bachelor in Hospitality Management & International Tourism and John holds a bachelor in Marketing & Communication. 
We are committed to greeting our guests with large measures of Hellenic Filoxenia! 
We both love traveling and discovering new cultures.

name: Sun Marco by Acropolis (6A)
description:
Set in the centre of Athens, within 500 metres of Ermou Street-Shopping Area and 800 metres of Syntagma & Monastiraki Metro Stations, Sun Marco Apartments in Athens offers accommodation with free WiFi.

Accommodation is fitted with air conditioning, a fully equipped kitchenette, a flat-screen TV and a private bathroom with bidet, free toiletries and a hairdryer. A fridge, a microwave and stovetop are also offered, as well as a coffee machine and a kettle.
neighborhood_overview: Monastiraki is suitable for long walks in the narrow streets full of countless small stores where on Sunday there is an open market right next to the remains of the Roman Agora and under the Acropolis. From the other hand there is Psiri, one of the liveliest districts with endless choices of bars, cafes, restaurants and shops. In addition, only a few meters away the famous 150 years old Municipal Varvakios fish Market and Evripidou Street the so called 'traditional market area' full of spices, herbs, meat, cold cuts and dairy products from small artisan producers all over Greece.
host_about: My name is Michael and I am an Athens based photographer and hospitality manager for great music Greek festivals. I live with my wife and family and our dog 'Lola'. I am passionate with my art and I love to work with vintage motorcycles.With over a decade of experience in the service of great stars of the world music scene, I decide to create my own B&B spaces for your own pleasure.

name: Theo Homeybee Exarcheia  Apt No12-Room 1
description:
Hello Homey!

Cute and cosy 4th-floor private room in 5 rooms apartment in Exarchia, one of the most prominent urban neighbourhoods in the heart of Athens. Being close to public transport stations (metro, bus, railway), yet in walking-distance from a variety of historic landmarks and must-see places in the city, it offers an ideal accommodation for individual travelers and loving couples!
neighborhood_overview:
A truly boheme neighbourhood in the heart of Athens.
Historic urban neighbourhood, one of the last authentic and unspoiled in Europe. Famous for its artistic essence and boheme aura, it is mostly inhabited and frequented by artists, musicians, writers, actors and creative minds. Low-paced daily routine, yet with plenty of nightlife choices, the neighbourhood will make you fall in love with the youthful urban lifestyle, from relaxing cafeterias and lively art spaces to alternative bars and picturesque restaurants. Pedion Areos Park are also great options for your morning walks, or even workouts - in case you’re the active type of person
host_about:
Hello, I'm Theo.
  I live in the neighborhood of Exarcheia and I deal exclusively with the short-term rental of my privately owned apartments, so I have the opportunity to have discreet but direct contact with my guests and I will be very happy to help your smooth stay in Athens.
  I live very close to all my apartments and, as I am fully committed to the convenience and care of my guests' accommodation, I am always happy to meet new people and share local tips and "inside information" of the city.

  During the summer, I am also happy to have my guests at home for coffee or a drink - my house has a wonderful terrace with stunning views of Lycabettus, the Parthenon and the cityscape of Athens.  You'll love it!  In any other case, you will probably meet  coffee of the Exarcheion say hello and have a raki with me!

  We hope to see you soon!

name: Standard Double by 33 Solonos
description: Our room can comfortably accommodate 2 guests and offers city views. It features a queen-size bed. The linens in this suite are dressed in comforting and distinct icy grey hues. In the bathroom, aside from the double glass door shower, guests will find a range of branded products, a hairdryer, and a flat iron. There’s also a minibar and a flat-screen TV. The room features a fully equipped kitchenette, an Espresso bar, and a safety deposit box. All bedrooms come with free Wi-Fi.
host_about:
We are Bill & John two young entrepreneurs with family ties. We were both born in Athens and continue living in this fascinating city. We have both spent our early years in the tourism and hospitality industry assisting our family in its hotel and tour operator ventures. Bill holds a bachelor in Hospitality Management & International Tourism and John holds a bachelor in Marketing & Communication. 
We are committed to greeting our guests with large measures of Hellenic Filoxenia! 
We both love traveling and discovering new cultures.

name: Artistic room in a 100 sqm flat with a designer
description:
I am renting out one of my two bedrooms.

I am a nomad interior designer, art director, museum expert and curator. I renovated this 1950 typical Athenian flat in March 2023. The space is full of light, calm and precious items coming from Georgia, Mexico, India and Uzbekistan, where I lived.

This room is for someone who looks for quietness and rest.

If you are an art lover, you are welcome in my 100sqm cabinet of curiosities!!
host_about:
Hello, my name is Celia Stroom, I am an art historian and curator. 
I am also vocal coach, dancer, and yoga trainer. 
Since 2019, I am the coordinator of an international feminist collective of artists: « heroineswave » on social media 

I recently created in Athens a flat to welcome people who needs a moment of relief in their life.

name: Theo Homeybee Pipinou Apt No15-Room 2
description:
Hello Homey!

Cute and comfortable 4st floor private room in a two room apartment, next to Victoria Square, in the center of Athens and only 5 minutes away from Agios Georgios Square, a popular hang out spot. Being close to public transport stations (metro, buses, railway) but within walking distance of a variety of historical landmarks and must-see sites in the city, it offers an ideal accommodation for solo travelers and couples in love!
neighborhood_overview:
Charming and colorful neighborhood in the heart of Athens. Patision Street is one of the streets that were laid out in such a way that as you move towards the historical center you always have the Parthenon in your field of vision! It is the road where all public transport runs to and from the historic center with many shops! Directly opposite Patision Street begins the neighborhood of Kypseli.
"Kypseli" in Greek means beehive and the reasons for its name can easily be justified through a short walk through its colorful and charming streets, inhabited by people from countries and nationalities from all over the world. Multicultural and bohemian in its own special way, Kypseli is a wonderful area to explore, with a variety of cafes, restaurants and cultural meeting points. The financial University is very close for students, the Pedion Areos Park near the apartment and the pedestrian street of Fokionos Negri are also great options for your morning walks or even workouts - in ca
host_about:
Hello, I'm Theo.
  I live in the neighborhood of Exarcheia and I deal exclusively with the short-term rental of my privately owned apartments, so I have the opportunity to have discreet but direct contact with my guests and I will be very happy to help your smooth stay in Athens.
  I live very close to all my apartments and, as I am fully committed to the convenience and care of my guests' accommodation, I am always happy to meet new people and share local tips and "inside information" of the city.

  During the summer, I am also happy to have my guests at home for coffee or a drink - my house has a wonderful terrace with stunning views of Lycabettus, the Parthenon and the cityscape of Athens.  You'll love it!  In any other case, you will probably meet  coffee of the Exarcheion say hello and have a raki with me!

  We hope to see you soon!

neighborhood_overview:
Pangrati is a lively neighbourhood with everything you need within one block- cafes, supermarkets, restaurants, bus stops..!
The are itself is residential, real Greek area. It is safe, it is local, it gives you the glimpse of true Greek life. Same time being very conveniently near everything a tourist comes to see in Athens :)
Architecture is modest- typical Greek residential area, but really very safe (even at night!) and easy connected with centre. Syntagma is 10 min by trolleybus, 20 min by walk, or 5 min by taxi (5-6 euros- if you are asked more, then you have an dishonest driver)
Very easy route to and from AIRPORT (bus X95 to Syntagma and then 5 eur Taxi) and ship port- instructions provided in itinerary.
It is comfortably near the centre, walking distance to the tourist are is 10 min (First Olympic Stadium) the Acropolis is further another 10min - the walk to city from Olympic stadium goes between Zeus temple and Zapio/National Gardens- so it is a fantas

name: Private Athenian Oasis: Luxe Suite & Sunny Balcony
description: Step into an exclusive world of utmost privacy and indulgence in the heart of Athens. Nestled in a larger townhouse, your luxurious private room awaits you on the first floor, offering a spacious and secluded haven spanning 40m2. With a separate entrance, enjoy a sense of complete independence and the convenience of having your own full bathroom, kitchenette, living room, and a sun-drenched balcony that overlooks a lush green park.
neighborhood_overview:
Nestled in the select residential neighborhood of Neos Kosmos, our enchanting haven offers a safe and central location, placing all of Athens' wonders within your reach.

Immerse yourself in the historical allure just steps away. Cross the Acropolis ring road and venture into the exclusive managed entrances to Filopappou Hill. Traverse the abundant walking trails and uncover archaeological treasures along the way. Within a leisurely 15-minute stroll, you'll find yourself captivated by the grandeur of the Acropolis and the charm of Plaka, where ancient history intertwines with vibrant modernity.

Indulge in the thriving energy of the neighboring Koukaki area, an urban neighborhood beloved by locals and visitors alike. Delight in casual dining experiences, traditional tavernas, and lively bars. Explore the abundance of green groceries and markets, immersing yourself in the authentic flavors of Athens. Enjoy a stylish experience at this centrally-located place.

This is a room with a balcony in a shared two bedroom apartment. It is on the second floor of out building. It is located two blocks away from the Tower of Athens in Goudi/Ambelokipi, close to all means of transport, right by Kifisias Ave, Alexandras Ave and Medogeion Avenue.
host_about: I have studied design, literature and theatre and now run a property management company here in Athens.

name: Acropolis Rooms
description:
Step into a vibrant and designed room that radiates character and bright colors and the convenience of adjoining kitchen and bathroom.

Elevate your experience by climbing to our rooftop terrace. Here, a panoramic view of the iconic Acropolis awaits, making it the perfect spot to enjoy your morning coffee with a view that takes you back in time.

Stay connected with our friendly reception team available from 10 am to 9 pm daily live or via Whats App during the same hours.

name: Double Room, Central Athens 20 min from Acropolis
description: This room has everything you need to live, work and play. Get the practical things like fast WiFi, 24/7 support, mid-stay cleaning upon request, and fun stuff like a 42” smart TV. Stay in comfort for as long as you’d like – days, weeks or months.
neighborhood_overview: Experience Athens' vibrant centre, surrounded by lively shops selling local goods and tantalising cafes and restaurants. Step back in time amidst iconic landmarks, while enjoying modern comforts and efficient transport. Bob W Eolou is just a 9-minute walk from the Ancient Agora and 1.3 km from the majestic Acropolis, with a 5-minute stroll to the Monastiraki metro station for easy city exploration.
host_about: After travelling around the world from Chicago to Kathmandu and everywhere in between, I created apartments that combine the best of boutique hotels and authentic homes. When you stay with me, you always get: an awesome location in a handpicked neighbourhood, interiors created by local designers, and a commitment to sustainability. My team of professional hospitality superheroes is here for you day and night to make sure you have a 5-star stay.

neighborhood_overview:
The building
This mid-century, modernism-style property in central Athens was freshly renovated in 2019. These apartments are located on the first, second, and third floors and are accessible by lift. This is a contactless property, which means there’s no front desk. You can access both the building and your space with a convenient door code, and our super-responsive online support team is here for you day and night.

Lovely bedroom inside an apartment in the center of Athens with a personal and young design touch.

We hope that you will enjoy our place as much as we do love it !

description: Our lovely building was built in the beginning of the 20th century, witnessing the organic relationship between Athens and neoclassical architecture. name: YourSpace7 - Oinapothiki Taverna
description:
YourSpace6 suite of Oinapothiki wine Taverna next to Kallimarmaro Stadium, is the place to be for your short staying in Athens Historical center!
Private rooms with a comfortable bed, a working space, fully air-conditioning with a minibar fridge, a bright window and electronic locking system for your convenient self check in anytime you arrive home. A shared small kitchen to prepare your breakfast, 2 toilets, 2 showers and 2 seating rooms over our wine Taverna!

Residential Diversity: Ampelokipoi is a densely populated area with a diverse mix of residents, including families, young professionals, students, and expatriates. The neighborhood's residential streets are lined with apartment buildings of varying architectural styles, from modern high-rises to historic buildings with ornate facades.

name: Play Theatrou Presidential Suite
description:
100 m², 5 adults
The Presidential suite includes three comfortable bedrooms and two bathrooms.
It has a sitting area, a dining area, and a kitchenette, surrounded by a large balcony with urban view up to the Acropolis hill.
Designed in a minimalist style, equipped with functional and comfortable furniture.
Includes queen-size beds, fresh linens and towels, bathrobes and slippers, an electric kettle, a Nespresso machine, various coffee capsules, a tea and sugar set, a small fridge and a safe.
host_about:
PLAY Theatrou Hotel is where you want to start your journey!

Come to experience Athens as the locals do.

Visit endless art galleries, workshops, shops, and boutiques, or walk through the small alleys next to street art displays or not-so-polite graffiti.

Day and night, the Psyri neighborhood is a concentrated capsule of an authentic, happy, colorful Greek celebration. 
Consider yourself invited.

neighborhood_overview:
Kato Patisia is a vibrant neighborhood in Athens, situated in the northern part of the city. It's known for its lively atmosphere, diverse community, and a mix of residential and commercial areas. The neighborhood has a rich history and is characterized by a combination of older and more modern buildings.

You can find traditional Greek tavernas, cafes, and shops lining the streets, offering a taste of local culture. The area is well-connected with public transportation, making it easy to explore other parts of Athens.

Kato Patisia provides a glimpse into everyday life in Athens, away from the more touristy areas. It's a great place to experience the city's authentic charm and interact with locals. If you have specific questions or interests about Kato Patisia.

Bathrooms are affixed with bathtubs and soothing showerheads while complimentary toiletries are provided. Acropolis Select Hotel provides you an American buffet breakfast every morning.
neighborhood_overview:
Athens is one of the world’s oldest cities, as its recorded history spans around 3,400 years. According to Greek mythology, the city was given its name as a result of a competition between the Olympian gods, Poseidon and Athena, about who will become protector of the city. The myth goes that Poseidon provided a well with sea water whilst Athena offered an olive tree, a symbol of peace and prosperity, as she touched the ground of the sacred rock of the Acropolis. The people of Athens chose Athena as their protector and so the city was named after her. The two gods represent the strength of Athens as a city of wisdom and as a sea power.

The Acropolis Select Hotel is located in the Athenian suburb of Koukaki, one of the adjoining neighborhoods that borders the southern section of the Acropolis,Philopappos Hill and the historical district of Plaka. This area is occupied by beautiful neoclassical buildings along its narrow streets and the pedestrianized Dionysiou Areopagitou Aven
host_about:
We are Bill & John two young entrepreneurs with family ties. We were both born in Athens and continue living in this fascinating city. We have both spent our early years in the tourism and hospitality industry assisting our family in its hotel and tour operator ventures. Bill holds a bachelor in Hospitality Management & International Tourism and John holds a bachelor in Marketing & Communication. 
We are committed to greeting our guests with large measures of Hellenic Filoxenia! 
We both love traveling and discovering new cultures.

Situated conveniently in the centre of Athens, Living Yard Thissio features 4-star accommodation close to Monastiraki Metro Station and Monastiraki Railway Station.
At the hotel, the rooms come with a desk. Complete with a private bathroom equipped with a shower and free toiletries, the units at Living Yard Thissio have a flat-screen TV and air conditioning, and selected rooms will provide you with a balcony. At the accommodation all rooms are fitted with bed linen and towels.

name: Athena Cozy Nest
description: Athena Cozy Nest - Bright and Comfy Gem
host_about:
Hi ! Im Chris! I 'm the owner of 9 apartments in the centre (Email hidden by Airbnb) and my team  love the city we live and had a vision to create Hellenic Houses with artistry and show the traditional Greek Hospitality to friends from every part of the world.You are all welcome and we are ready to accommodate you in our five clean and cosy  Hellenic Houses in order  to experience the way of our life, staying in Athens.
Hellenic Houses are located on the Aiolou Street, a pedestrian street with street vendors, musicians, shops and cuisine from all parts of the world. We want to introduce you to graphic small alleys, taverns with unique Greek flavors, multicultural bars and help you navigate seamlessly the archaeological sites, museums and ancient Athens.

name: Theo Homeybee Victoria Οmonia Apt No14-Room4
description:
Welcome Homey!

Cute and cosy 2nd-floor private room in a four room apartment in Exarchia, one of the most prominent urban neighbourhoods in the heart of Athens. Being close to public transport stations (metro, bus, railway), yet in walking-distance from a variety of historic landmarks and must-see places in the city, it offers an ideal accommodation for individual travelers.
neighborhood_overview:
The Neighbourhood: A truly boheme neighborhood in the heart of Athens.
Historic urban neighborhood, one of the last authentic and unspoiled in Europe. Famous for its artistic essence and boheme aura, it is mostly inhabited and frequented by artists, musicians, writers, actors and creative minds. Low-paced daily routine, yet with plenty of nightlife choices, the neighborhood will make you fall in love with the youthful urban lifestyle, from relaxing cafeterias and lively art spaces to alternative bars and picturesque restaurants. Pedion Areos Park and Lycabettus Hill are also great options for your morning walks or workouts - in case you’re the active type of person!
host_about:
Hello, I'm Theo.
  I live in the neighborhood of Exarcheia and I deal exclusively with the short-term rental of my privately owned apartments, so I have the opportunity to have discreet but direct contact with my guests and I will be very happy to help your smooth stay in Athens.
  I live very close to all my apartments and, as I am fully committed to the convenience and care of my guests' accommodation, I am always happy to meet new people and share local tips and "inside information" of the city.

  During the summer, I am also happy to have my guests at home for coffee or a drink - my house has a wonderful terrace with stunning views of Lycabettus, the Parthenon and the cityscape of Athens.  You'll love it!  In any other case, you will probably meet  coffee of the Exarcheion say hello and have a raki with me!

  We hope to see you soon!

description:
Enjoy the simple things in this serene and centrally-located place. Excellent, comfortable room with loggia overlooking Lysikratous Square on the 1st floor of a traditional house, fully renovated.
In the center of old Athens , the historical area of Plaka, on the oldest street in Europe, Tripodon Street. Exactly what a guest needs to do their explorations.
Unique moments in the space where theater, philosophy, arts and sciences were born.

name: Private Lux Room at Historical Center of Athens
description: A spacious PRIVATE room nested within our SHARED apartment featuring a premium, ultra-comfortable bed. Just steps away, immerse yourself in art and culture at the Museum of Modern Arts. The wonders of Athens await, with the Acropolis and Syntagma Square just a delightful 15-minute stroll away, while the Acropolis Museum and vibrant Plaka neighborhood are a mere 10-minute jaunt. After a day of exploration, return to our inviting space and unwind in style. Your Athenian adventure starts here
host_about:
Hey there! I'm Leon, and along with my partner in life, Andromeda, we're avid travelers and kitesurfing enthusiasts. We've crafted a cozy spot right in the heart of Athens, designed to welcome fellow adventure seekers like you and offer a beautiful experience during your visit.

By day, I'm a sound engineer, but hosting has always been a dream of mine. We're thrilled to open our doors and share our love for travel and hospitality with you.

Welcome to your PRIVATE Cozy Room in our SHARED Appartment.
This is a spacious room in a fully equiped comfortable, clean and safe house. Queen size bed with Premium Mattress plus all you might need for having a pleasant stay.
The house is located in the most central area of Athens. Just a few meters awat is the Siggrou/Fix metro station. 15 minutes walk from Acropolis. Less than 10 minutes walk from Acropolis museum and Sintagma Square. 2 minutes away from the Museum of Modern Art.
host_about:
Hey there! I'm Leon, and along with my partner in life, Andromeda, we're avid travelers and kitesurfing enthusiasts. We've crafted a cozy spot right in the heart of Athens, designed to welcome fellow adventure seekers like you and offer a beautiful experience during your visit.

By day, I'm a sound engineer, but hosting has always been a dream of mine. We're thrilled to open our doors and share our love for travel and hospitality with you.

description: Welcome to your perfect getaway in the heart of Athens! This stylish and cozy room offers everything you need for a comfortable stay, including all essential amenities. neighborhood_overview: Psirri is one of Athens' most vibrant and eclectic neighborhoods, offering a delightful blend of old-world charm and modern energy. Located just a stone's throw from the Acropolis, this lively area is renowned for its colorful street art, trendy bars, cozy cafes, and an array of unique shops. By day, explore its bustling markets and artisan workshops; by night, experience its dynamic nightlife with live music and entertainment. Psirri is the perfect place to immerse yourself in the authentic spirit of Athens, where tradition meets contemporary culture.

name: Sharing can change the world!
description:
Stay here if you want to be centrally located, still a bit out of the tourist maelstrom, at the neighborhood of Koukaki.

Private room, fully equipped, 4th floor, 7min walking to the Acropolis museum (600m), 3min walking-distance to Syngrou Fix Metro Station (290m).

Enjoy your stay at this peaceful and centrally-located place!
host_about:
Hello! I am born, raised and still live in Athens. I love my city and i am always glad to meet people from different countries and share with them our love for Athens. 
I work as a professional dancer as well as a therapist of alternative medicine (i practice Shiatsu and Rejuvance). 
I would be glad to host you and offer suggestions on great places to visit while being in Athens! Welcome!

name: Voulis - 1
description:
Located in one of the most central and historic areas of Athens, this elegant and functional apartment is a unique opportunity.
Voulis Street is one of the most vibrant and historic areas of Athens. Residents have the opportunity to enjoy the charm of the old town with its modern amenities of culture and entertainment. The apartment is close to supermarkets, shops, pharmacies as well as some of the city's most popular restaurants and cafes.

name: Triple room -shared bathroom &AC
description:
Enjoy a private room in a quiet and relaxing area of Athens! Our property comes with a shared kitchen and dining room where you are more than welcome to prepare your meals. We also have a small backyard full with plants and flowers where you can, eat, chill or lay on a hammock.
There are bars, restaurants, supermarkets, pharmacies close to the property, the train stop is within 4 minutes walking distance.
In less than 20 minutes you can be in the city's center. Easy acces to port and airport
host_about:
I love traveling !!!
My job is about tourism also so I know exactly what you need for a successful vacation, my English is pretty good and I love to meet people from all over the world and make new friends.

Motto: "Give me a good reason and the possibilities are endless."

name: Theo Homeybee Apartment No18-11
description: Enjoy a stylish experience at this centrally located place.
host_about:
Hello, I'm Theo.
  I live in the neighborhood of Exarcheia and I deal exclusively with the short-term rental of my privately owned apartments, so I have the opportunity to have discreet but direct contact with my guests and I will be very happy to help your smooth stay in Athens.
  I live very close to all my apartments and, as I am fully committed to the convenience and care of my guests' accommodation, I am always happy to meet new people and share local tips and "inside information" of the city.

  During the summer, I am also happy to have my guests at home for coffee or a drink - my house has a wonderful terrace with stunning views of Lycabettus, the Parthenon and the cityscape of Athens.  You'll love it!  In any other case, you will probably meet  coffee of the Exarcheion say hello and have a raki with me!

  We hope to see you soon!

description: A beautiful guest room, at a unique personal style flat, just next to the Archaeological Museum of Athens, next to Architecture and Polytechnic University, extremely close to all kind of public transportation. name: Theo Homeybee Exarcheia Apt No20-4
description:
Hello Homey!

Cute and cosy 4th-floor private room in 5 rooms apartment in Exarchia, one of the most prominent urban neighbourhoods in the heart of Athens. Being close to public transport stations (metro, bus, railway), yet in walking-distance from a variety of historic landmarks and must-see places in the city, it offers an ideal accommodation for individual travelers and loving couples!
host_about:
Hello, I'm Theo.
  I live in the neighborhood of Exarcheia and I deal exclusively with the short-term rental of my privately owned apartments, so I have the opportunity to have discreet but direct contact with my guests and I will be very happy to help your smooth stay in Athens.
  I live very close to all my apartments and, as I am fully committed to the convenience and care of my guests' accommodation, I am always happy to meet new people and share local tips and "inside information" of the city.

  During the summer, I am also happy to have my guests at home for coffee or a drink - my house has a wonderful terrace with stunning views of Lycabettus, the Parthenon and the cityscape of Athens.  You'll love it!  In any other case, you will probably meet  coffee of the Exarcheion say hello and have a raki with me!

  We hope to see you soon!
